review_body: I can honestly say one of the best hostels I have stayed in. It was a very last min find, but it did not dissapoint. Great location. The staff were friendly, helpful and fun. I always had something to do during the day with their good range of excursions available, and for a good price. The atmosphere was great every evening. If you are a solo traveller, I would HIGHLY recommend staying here. You are guaranteed to make friends for life. I stayed in a 6 person dorm. Very pleased with the condition and cleanliness of it, the cleaners were there daily. Lockers for valuables (don't forget a lock for it). Access to Fridge and freezer. And the rooftop is a great social area, during the day and at night. All in all, brilliant, I did not want to leave. Fantastic hostel.

My stay at this hostel was just perfect, warm, cosy and UNIQUE. The reception was super friendly and always helpful with everything. Even the cleaning ladies were so friendly, they became real friends of mine. They organised daily tours for a really good price in which you could experience the whole island. My favourite activity was the skydive that they offered to do. When will you get such a chance to skydive in Hawaii! Out of that every night the rooftop is THE place to be. DRINKS, FRIENDS and FUN, what do you need more in life.After the night you can expect a nice breakfast with waffles, fruit, peanut butter, bread...etc. No complaints from me tho.If I come back to Hawaii, I will definetely book the same hostel, without any hesitation!Thanks for giving me this out of the world experience..

My friend and I stayed at the beach Waikiki for our 2 week stay in Honolulu! I had never stayed in a hostel before so didn’t know what to expect but I can honestly say it was the best experience ever!!! The staff are some of the nicest people, so welcoming and helpful and also super fun!! The tours and activities they offer are incredible! We went on a booze cruise with the hostel and it was one of the highlights of my trip!!! The rooms are very spacious with great amenities! Thanks to Ashley, Andrew, jaimie and all the other staff who made our trip and stay one to remember! I cannot wait to stay there again for my next trip back to Honolulu! Thanks!!! ❤️

My friend and I visited Oahu for 6 days and had tons of fun! We were welcomed with Hawaiian chocolate and the hostel is only a block away from Waikiki beach. They offer great tours every single day in the week for 10-20$ (depending on the distance) tipping the driver. My friend and I visited Manoa Falls, Tantalus Lookout, Makapuu and Lanakaii Beach through those tours and had much fun! Our guide took us down the cliffs at Makapuu to enjoy the tide pools. He’s the best! (Pic 2)We had one FREE pizza night in the week, lots of great food top hangouts and a movie night and they always offer different and new events you can be a part of! Thanks to the hostel and tours we were able to make a lot of European friends during our stay! Shout out to our „Hostel Gang“ (pic 1)! 100% recommend!

This is an excellent hostel - great price, great location and most importantly..excellent staff!! Zain was very accommodating when I had a minor room mix up! Staff are at the front desk 24/7 to answer questions about things to do in Waikiki and surrounding areas. The hostel offers excursions every day - hikes, party boat, etc. Beds comfortable enough. Clean rooms. Free breakfast. Great hostel to meet other solo travellers. Really awesome environment! Not a party hostel, quite hours after 10pm, so you are able to get a decent nights rest! I have been to many hostels during my travels but I have to say - I haven’t seen such personable and helpful staff before! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this hostel!

Absolutely loved my stay at the Beach Waikiki Boutique hostel. Great vibes, perfect location, and amazing people! My Hawaii days were filled with laughter, new friends, and memories for a lifetime. Thankful to their super friendly staff for making my trip so good. Definitely coming back.

I always travel solo and look for hostels where I can make friends.. but this one exceeded my expectations. The environment it’s great, the staff it’s super nice, the hostel has a lot of activities in which you can get to know Hawaii and it’s people and have fun with other residents. It’s really close to Waikiki beach and all the tourist places. The hostel also has a rooftop where everybody goes at night after a day of sightseeing and or surfing, some bring musical instruments and everybody ends up having a great time. I Met a lot of people that I’m still in touch with, it was a great experience.

Had to be the Most welcoming and Best Hostel in Hawaii. Location was almost at the beach , Met the most wonderful staff on reception. Thankyou To All staff for making this the most Amazing & budget holiday i've had. Yes!! it's one Big Happy family. Bring your own drinks to roof top Get togethers. tours everyday of the week at great prices..Thanks to Mike. Enjoyed every minute. Met a fantastic bunch of young people in the hostel the environment is buzzing with fun and lovely people. Always a Great atmosphere. Would look forward to returning again some day!

Honestly can say I enjoyed everything about my stay at The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel. The people were incredible (both the staff and the other travellers) I know I’ve made friends for life. The tours were SO good, great value for money, great locations and excellent tour guide. I stayed in both a semi private and the 4 person all female dorm and they were both clean and comfortable. Awesome social vibe at the hostel, the common areas are fun and there are always people willing to chat, drink and have fun. Great location super close to Waikiki beach, food, shopping etc Overall they provided me with what I believe was the best Hawaiian experience I could’ve had and will definitely be back when I can.

Loved this hostel so much!! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, including Mike with the tours. He was knowledgeable about the island and made the tours fun. This was my first solo trip and staying in this hostel was the best thing because I meet some great people and made heaps of memories. The tours that the hostel offered were amazing as it was cheap and allowed me to see the north shore, pearl harbour, Lanikai, and koko head, which were all wonderful! I definitely would go back and would highly recommend it to others looking to stay in Waikiki!

Amazing people, the staff creates a welcoming community. Everyone there is so friendly with each other, it's insanely easy to make friends here because of the atmosphere created by the whole staff. Not just short term friends, but real long term friends with people all over the world. They help you out with any request you have, location is perfect. Ashley, Micheal, Andrew, Zain, Brandon, Tim, all so helpful with 24/7 service. Won't forget the late nights, the moped trips, all the fun on the rooftop party/nearby bars, and of course the tours. The tours are amazing because they take care of everything for you, just pay the low fee. Moped rental is seconds away. I'M COMING BACK!! Miss you all.

I stayed at the beach Waikiki boutique hostel for a couple of weeks, solo, and had the most welcoming and fun time. My favorite place was the little hammock in front of my room and the rooftop common area. Everyday they have activities you can join such as hiking, a tour to Pearl Harbor, pizza night etc. you’ll never feel alone but also you have enough hidden spots to get some time for yourself. The first time I stayed at the hostel with my mom in May 2018 and she loved it. No matter what age or gender, you’ll get a heartwarming welcome. The waffle breakfast is legendary, it’s really clean and they have the nicest staff one could ask for. Waikiki beach is only 2 minutes away, every Saturday there’s a little farmers market around the corner, bus stations close by to get everywhere and lots of affordable places to eat. Best thing, the rainbow drive as well as Ono Seafood are as well in walking distance!! If you're looking for fun, party or great company for hikes or any other adventure, I’d highly recommend this hostel. Mahalo and much love for this hostel from Germany!

The Beach Waikiki Hostel was the most generous and memorable stays. Their tours and opportunities were strategically perfect for getting to know the island and feeling at home with meeting new friends. I only stayed for 4 days but the amount of activities I was able to be apart of and memories I have made / people I have met, will stay with me for a lifetime. I would encourage anyone and everyone to stay there. They are walking distance to the best places to eat, drink, and shop.. as well as being right off the beach. Their tours give access to the most beautiful views, hikes and historic places on the island. Definitely going back whenever I can.

Let me tell you about a place near the (touristy) beach of Waikiki. We stayed here two nights and I wish we had more time. The staff was extremely helpful and, to us anyway, felt like locals. They gave us tips, advice, destinations, and activities to do as well as told us what to avoid. From the morning waffles to the evening rooftop pregaming, it can be your party destination or your bed to just crash. They even offered me first aid supplies when needed. I would recommend this place to anyone traveling through or looking for an extended place to crash.

After wanting to go to Hawaii for a couple of years I took the plunge and purchased some sale flights to embark on a solo adventure.As soon as I arrived at the hostel I instantly received a warm welcome and was put into contact with one of my roommates, another solo traveller who I went on an instant adventure with! I stayed at the hostel for 2 weeks and in that time my travel friends came and went but the friendly group atmosphere of the hostel meant that I was never alone. The rooftop bar was a great place to hang out & meet people to go on adventures with & the hostel never ran out of group activities to do everyday.Big shoutout to Ashley who is an all time legend! Makes everyone feel comfortable & brings people together, knows the island well & is always recommending great things to do. I would recommend this hostel to anyone wanting a fun time in Hawaii :)

The Beach Waikiki boutique hostel was my first time ever hostel experience, and let me tell you I was not a single bit disappointed! I wasn’t too sure what to expect, but it honestly changed the way I would like to travel in the future! Firstly, my trip to Hawaii was very spontaneous and last-minute. What was supposed to be a girls trip with a close childhood friend ended up being a solo trip as we realized we didn’t have the same travel-style/itinerary of things we wanted to do while on the island of Oahu. So we went our own ways. Never having travelled solo before, I was slightly anxious... BUT EVERYONE AT THE HOSTEL WAS SO NICE, guests and staff alike! The hostel’s organized activities each day were so much fun (not to mention very reasonably priced!) and made it super easy to make friends with people staying at the same hostel (which would lead to daily roof top chillings and meetings at the beach for sunset just a good big gang of friends). Special shout-out to Ashley working at the hostel who made me feel so at home while I was there that I almost didn’t leave!! Being back home now, Im still in touch with so many people from all over the world that I met during my stay at the Beach Waikiki boutique hostel. I rate this hostel 5/5 for its SOCIAL aspect, best people who are always down for a good time. Even someone who’s quite shy, as myself would find themselves at ease, very friendly environment :)Second, as someone who’s never stayed in a hostel beforehand, I was very impressed with the facilities, nice clean spacious rooms, great rooftop lounging area, BEST BEST BEST LOCATION (literally one block and a half from the beach and close to everything you could possibly need), FREE delicious waffles and coffee every morning, FREE wifi... honestly I didn’t have a single problem, even when I got locked out of my room twice whoever at the front desk would be more than happy to come open it up for me :) I rate this hostel 5/5 for its LOCATION/FACILITIES*Note* I stayed some nights in a semi private room which was very nice, your own room with a shared bathroom and common area.. didn’t have a problem with noise or anything. Also stayed in a mixed dorm of 4, which was great, by then I already knew the people in my dorm from the activities and it was just like a big sleepover among friends.The only thing I would say is this is not the place to go if you don’t wanna socialize, Waikiki in general for me was very sociable, hard not to socialize, everyone is so nice. This hostel had a really great balance of having the option to party and go crazy if you wanted, but also settle down for the night with the 10pm quiet curfew if you’re in need of a good sleep. ALL IN ALL THIS HOSTEL HAS SET THE BAR PRETTY HIGH FOR MY FUTURE ADVENTURES!! THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR MAKING MY TRIP UNFORGETTABLE!!!

This was one of the best accommodations I have ever been to! Very neat and clean with a friendly and helpful staff, you can feel positivity and aloha all around. Delicious breakfast in the morning (amazing coffee creamer, waffle and peanut butter), several activities for free in the afternoon and in the evening. What else should a traveler wish for? I am glad that I booked accommodation in this hostel and I am sure that if I ever visit Hawaii again, I will stay at this hostel. Mahalo for everything!

siiiiick place! everyone so friendly, loved the location, the party staff! great location just by waikiki!!! thanks to everyone who made it great...btw free dominos pizza on thursday night! u wont find it anywhere else

Best hostel in Hawaii hands down. The staff were so hospitable and fun. Super chilled and all the guests I stayed with were respectful. Thanks guys, special shoutout to Ashley had the best time bar crawling.

This was my second time staying here and both times I have had such amazing experiences. The staff here are fantastic and very welcoming, I even consider some of them my friends now. Very social hostel, making it easy to make plenty of friends to do things with if you are solo traveling. Even though it’s a social hostel it’s quiet after 10 pm so if you want to get a good night sleep you are still able to. Super close to everything including the beach, so no need to have a rental car your entire visit. They also have planned day trips/ tours as well which is super convenient! I’ve already recommended this hostel to all of my friends. Can’t wait to return!

During my time on Oahu, I stayed at 3 different hostel. Boutique Hostel was the BEST, and by far! Staff is friendly, travelers are respectful, and perfect location. Best part: you can do tours with Mike, awesome mate, during the day, and come back to a pizza night with everyone at the hostel!I did one mistake during my trip, and it was not booking this place for the whole trip, and it got fully booked very quickly. Book there and you won't regret it!Felix from Canada

The hostel atmosphere was amazing and all the staff were super friendly and accommodating. Free breakfast every morning! The highlight for my friends and I was Mike’s tours. We went to all 4 tours from Monday-Thursday and loved every single one of them. Lanikai beach is a must! Snorkelling, hiking, and beaches, and good food? What more can you ask for...

Friendly staff, 24 hours reception, really good waffles for breakfast :DThere are activities and tours everyday - easy to meet people from the hostel. Mike, the organizer plans the tours and drives you around so it's stress-free and fun! Hostel is walking distance to the beach and feels safe!

The Beach Boutique Hostel is in a very convenient location in Waikiki with an awesome/friendly staff! They offer tours everyday of the week at a very affordable price. Mike is a super cool guide and takes groups of up to 12 people to all the cool sites/beaches/hikes/waterfalls/scuba/snorkel/skydive/booze cruise spots on the island of Oahu. I highly recommend this hostel for anyone looking for a fun place to stay while in Oahu. 5 stars!

Had an amazing time hanging out at Waikiki Boutique Hostel. Took a few of the organized trips with Mike and they were definitely worth it. Meet a lot of fun people in the hostel and went out almost every night.As a solo traveler this was all I ever needed of a hostel. Organized trips, social events and a good place to hangout outside if the rooms

What a great place to stay. From the cleanliness to the friendly staff, this hostel was amazing. I met some awesome people and went on unforgettable adventures. Special shoutout to Ashley - she works hard to make it a fun place to stay!

I stayed here for 3 nights in January 2020. I was warmly welcomed by Ashley at the desk and she was able to promptly get me set up for my stay. Right away it felt like previous hostels I stayed at in Southeast Asia; ones with community, where the staff are as accommodating as if they were the ones traveling, where you could make friends after a drink. After the first night, my impression was correct. For those three nights, people were always on the rooftop happy to mingle. People made recommendations on places and things to see and do, others would find out they were on the same tour (organized through the hostel), it was a great way to make a social circle as a solo-traveler. In the morning, they have a continental breakfast. I never had a chance to try it but the rumour was that Devina whips up wicked waffles. They also have music they play on a BT speaker at the front desk; it was all solid music that I enjoyed (I suggest mixing in FJM and Arcade Fire). Working in the industry, I know one of the challenging parts of the job is remembering the names to guest's faces. Despite being there during a few nights of full occupancy, Ashley remembered me every time. It's impressive she can do this with everyone who stays there. I look forward to exploring more of Hawaii. I will be staying at a hostel somewhere in Maui in the future. I look forward to staying at The Beach Maui Boutque Hostel. PS - I think clothespins would be a nice touch.

It was a great, welcoming hostel. Really liked everything about it. The staff is good, it's like they're part of the hostel and the entire community. Overall clean, good rooftop place to hang out, great crowd, easy to make friends, they organize trips around island. Very close to the beach, easy access by bus.  Without this hostel my Hawaii experience for the first time wouldn't be the same. Very thankful that I got to stay there and will stay again in the future. You won't regret it!

My partner and I stayed at the hostel for four nights in December. The hostel is located at the end of the tourist strip in Waikiki and is walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The atmosphere of the hostel was very friendly and relaxed and we enjoyed meeting new people. We had a private room, which was very small but the beds were comfortable and we were able to sleep well. The hostel is a great option for singles or couples alike. I would highly recommend it!

This was my first time staying at a hostel and I was very impressed by the quality of the place and the amazing time I had there. Everyone there - especially the staff - were very welcoming and friendly. I stayed in the 4-bed female dorm for 6 nights. The room had two single-sized bunkbeds, a full-size fridge, a sink, kitchen cabinets, AC unit, lockers, and a small bathroom with a shower. Bunkbeds were comfy and sheets were soft and very clean. Bathroom was clean and the shower had plenty of hot water. The lockers were small (about a foot square), but easily held all my important items. I brought a masterlock combination lock which worked perfectly. The room was very secure and I felt that I was in good hands throughout my stay. The tours through the hostel were amazing! Very cheap and good quality. I ended up cancelling a lot of my other tours because the hostel offered similar ones for much lower prices. They offer several hikes (~$15-20), an afternoon boat cruise (~$40) and a day trip to the north shore (~$30), all of which I would recommend. There were a few other options, but I did not sign up for them. They also offer discounted rates on sky diving, luaus, and surf lessons. I went to one of the luaus and had a fantastic time. You can sign out snorkel gear and reef shoes for free - just get there early to get the nicer gear - and get discounted rental fees for the rental place across the street (snorkel gear, surfboards, etc). Every night from 8pm to 10pm people would go to the rooftop common-space to hang out, meet people, and drink. Often groups would hit the bars afterwards. This was a very welcoming environment and I was making friends on my first night in the hostel! It was great for me, as a solo traveller! On Thursday there was free pizza! Overall, I would definitely recommend. The staff here really care about your stay - I dropped my key down the sink and they got it back for me (thanks Tim!). They were friendly, readily available (at the front desk 24/7!), and always ready to give advice on the sights of Oahu. On my 3rd night there was a mixup with rooms/booking and it was handled very professionally by the staff. If I were to stay again, I would definitely book a private or semi-private room. As a light sleeper, the bunk beds were a little too rickety for me to get some decent sleep. I would find it worthwhile to fork out the extra cash to get a bed to myself.

This is such a great hostel. The front desk team rock! They are so helpful and make this place so awesome. Ashley went above and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. Beds are super comfy, the place is always clean and the activities are a great way to see the island. Just a minute from the beach, and even closer to fab food spots.Keep up the good work guys and gals, 10/10

First time doing a Hostel with a friend, and if only all hostels were like the Beach Waikiki boutique. My friend and I did a private room and the room was spacious and tidy complete with Television, Full size fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, and microwave oven. Everyone at the hostel not just the employees are extremely nice. Every night everyone is welcome to have drinks and chat at the rooftop. You can also sign up for tours with Mike the driver and he absolutely amazing and helpful with any questions or tips you need. I highly suggest to make friends during the tours and visiting the rooftop(BTW closes at 10pm). Location of hostel is right near the beach great restaurants, the zoo and corner stores. P.SSign up early for any of the tours since space limited.5 dollars for baggage storage but not locked just in a watched open space, comes with using the shower.Also food trucks parked outside of hostel Try the empanadas.Say hi to Ashley at the front desk for us.

I was pleased with my stay. It was clean. I didn't see any bugs, and the cleaning staff did a good job,daily. The location is a small two block walk from Waikiki Beach. You can't beat that for the price! The tours give you something to do with others,if you want. There's a nominal fee for the driver's availability, but that's to be expected. The breakfast every morning is carb heavy,but with all of the hikes,you need it! Pizza night is awesome! The pizza was really good, actually! I am sad to see the recent ADVERTISEMENT tactics are catering more to the younger traveler. I'm not sure why. I am nothing like the customer image you cater to online. I pray they show more diversity and include all different cultures, ages, traveler profiles, etc., etc, in their photos and industry presence. I'm not sure if I feel as comfortable returning after seeing their new ads of half dressed young girls and partying teens. That's all good, but there's others that hostel, too. Ya know!? Diversity is the only reason I did not give it 5 stars on this late review. Keep up the good work that you already do(cleanliness, bug free, friendly & knowledgeable,activities, breakfast, pizza, towels, linens, etc.), but consider these improvements.

I recently just returned from a week long stay at the hostel. I can honestly say this was a really great hostel stay. The receptionist were very pleasant and welcoming. They made it easy for a guy like me to feel a comfortable in my first hostel stay. The rooms were similar to dorms in college. I stayed in two different dorms between trips to other islands and every person I met was really nice. The best experience I had was with the tours that the hostel provided. Each daily tour included either visits to scenic Oahu locations or fun excursions (Popular beaches, hiking spots, booze cruise, etc) This was all for a price that couldn't be beat.The tour guide was one of the nicest people i've met as well and he definitely makes the trips even more fun. In all I would recommend you stay here because this hostel is truly special and helped me make friends from all over that I would have never met otherwise.

I loved every minute of my stay here. I have booked my stay last minute and that was the best decision to make. I am traveling alone and this place not only offers day tours but also has an amazing roof top where it’s super easy to socialize. The breakfast is super nice and the stuff is very friendly.I can only recommend it. If I ever come back to Oahu I would 100% stay here again.

We stayed in a double semi-private room. The room itself was spacious and had excellent air con. However the bathroom and apartment area was in desperate need of a refurb and a good clean. The location of the hostel is perfect for getting to the beach and the tours with Mike are a definitely highlight. As a hostel it was okay but if you are booking a private room I would recommend spending a little more and staying in a hotel instead.

I stayed at The Beach Waikiki Hostel for 6 days and I can say it is great hostel for who is looking for company, friends and some adventures!!!The tours provided for the hostel were guided by Mike, who was excellent to conduct the group and explain all you need to know!!!The hostel facilitates the interaction of the guests, providing meetings at the rooftop every night!!!The staff was helpful, and they were accessible to answer all my questions by email before my arrival.I definitely recommend the hostel and I would come back for sure!!!

If I didn’t switch hostels after a couple nights, my experience would have been completely different. This hostel made it easy to meet people, offered good trips for cheaper prices, breakfast, and pizza on Thursday. You can rent snorkeling gear cheap across the street! It was a good one with a fridge in your room so people weren’t eating all your food and if so you could narrow down the suspects.

This hostel was one of the nicest, cleanest, and friendliest that I have stayed in. The location is great and everything is very walkable. Ashley and Victoria at the front desk are the best!! They were always so helpful and nice. The rooftop area is a great space to hang out. Definitely stay here

It was my first hostel experience and I’m so happy that I made the right choice:) Since the moment you arrive, you see how friendly and caring the staff is! I’ve stayed in a female dorm room for 4 people and as I was travelling solo, met amazing girls on the first night! The place is clean and has everything you need (locker, bedsheets, towers (extra), many people leave shampoos and other stuff)! There is a cleaning service everyday, so that helps a lot when all of you come back from the beach full of sand:) Also amazing breakfast every morning and the water refill machine that you can use 24/7, not many hostels have in Hawaii as water is quite expensive here, so it’s a big plus in this hostel! Each room has an air conditioner, as some point of the night I got a bit cold, and went to the reception (at 3am! There is always a person at the front) and asked for an extra blanket, so they have everything you need! All the activities are a must! Mike does different activities every single day, just remember book it as soon as possible, as it’s all in huge demand! My first trip was the boat tour one, if you have a chance, GO!!! You’ll meet so many amazing people! Overall, it was the most incredible experience for me and I cannot wait to go back:) Mahalo

Stayed here for one week (st.patricks weekend) with friends and can honestly say it was one of the best places I have stayed, from everyone who works here to the morning waffles and drinks on the rooftop, best atmosphere !!! It made our first trip to Hawaii even more memorable then what we expected. Extremely good price for what you get and staff cannot do enough to help you. If you are thinking about staying here DO IT, YOU WONT REGRET IT!! We miss you guys Irish gals ☘

The hostel is very clean and close to everything you need. If you’re looking to meet new friends the big rooftop hangout spot is perfect! The daily tours to different paradise destinations the hostel offers also make a great way to get to know people and the island of Oahu. Very nice and helpful staff and tour guide! Would definitely stay again!

Really awesome place to stay the staff at reception are awesome very helpful in giving information and very friendly a special thank you to ashley for helping me to get to the hospital. Cant thank her enough, love how at the hostel they always have activities going on so there always something to do. Mike hes awesome, The hostel its self was very nice and clean and the waffles are awesome. If i ever came back to waikiki i will definately stay here again thank u for the amazing hospitality

I stayed there 8 days in a 6-bedrooms and it was so nice.It was really better than what I was expecting for a hostel, the breakfast was delicious, the location is great, so close to the beach and bus stop. Rooms have air conditioning, a must in O'ahu. They have surf and snorkeling gear for renting.I did a couple of activities proposed by the hostel and I had a good time, great to meet people and to visit the Island without spending too much. Great guide.All their stuff were so friendly and helpful.

This is the first hostel I’ve ever stayed at and it did not disappoint! Walking distance from the main strip of shops and restaurants in Waikiki, with many hostel-exclusive tours on offer (shoutout to tour guide Mike and his impeccable music playlist) and a super fun and friendly atmosphere! Would definitely stay here again

I really enjoyed staying here - stayed for a week. Great location close to beach. Fave pet was meeting the people and going on all the awesome tours like north shore, lanikai and koko head - all unique experiences! I recommend :)

I liked the hostel a lot. It is on a top location. The rooms all have air conditioning. The staff is friendly and helpful. The toilet should be cleaned a little better. The unpleasant smells lingered for a long time in the bathroom and there is certainly room for improvement. Can you maybe provide the rooms with toilet cleaning agents? What you travellers simply have to be aware of is that you share your room with very different people. Unfortunately, I had to change rooms because one guy brought a girl to the room and they had sex. That was very disturbing and it made me very mad. Also in the second room I had to experience again how a couple had sex. Of course I complained again to the staff and it didn't happen again. Dear Staff, you must be much stricter. Such a thing is absolutely unacceptable. I know that it's not your fault, but you must kick these people immediately out of the hostel even though they paid!! I don't put up with that on my vacation. All in all quite clean, good value for money and a lot of cool people.

Good location. Friendly staff but a bid shabby - nothing boutique'e about it. There was no friendly outbreak area, aside of the roof terrace which contained a poor attempt of a kitchen but truly was too shabby to be welcoming. There is potential there though if someone just put some care into it. They do offer free tours, which I enjoyed. They have a friendly guide.

The staff are friendly and helpful, the tours are amazing value and show you some amazing spots, the location is unbeatable, and it is really affordable! When I come back I will definitely be staying here!And big shout out to Mike who arranges the tours who is super cool and will go out of his way to make your experience a great one!

Hands down the best hostel experience I could’ve asked for! The staff were amazing and it was super easy to make friends. The breakfast was great and the trips organised by the hostel was definitely the highlight. Shout out to Mike for taking us around!! There were variety of activities for each day of the week and it was so worth it. It was well organised and easy to book in and definitely worth the money spent. Super affordable Enjoyed every minute of my stay here. Thanks guys!!!

This was actually my first time staying in a hostel and I couldn’t have asked for a better time. All the staff are friendly and helpful and the vibe in the hostel is pretty incredible, as a solo traveller, it was so easy to meet new people and make new friends. The location of the hostel is amazing and the free breakfast and free pizza Thursday’s make for an even better stay. The hostel runs daily tours and activities at very reasonable prices courtesy of Mike, who is an incredibly friendly and knowledgeable guy who keeps the tours running smooth. I would highly recommend the tours not only for the content or activities but also because it’s a great way to meet other people as well. Overall, I had an amazing time at this hostel and I felt sad to leave even though I’d been there for 2 weeks. I will definitely be back!

I stayed in this hostel for 3 weeks with my sister, and we couldn’t have made a better choice. The staff is really friendly, good wifi and ac in the room, and awesome waffles for breakfast. There’s also free pizza parties (every other thursday I think) and the rooftop is always open, so it’s really easy to socialize and get to know the other people in the hostel. The best part for me were the trips that the hostel provided: for every day of the week there’s a day trip you can sign up to, and I loved it because a) super cheap (much cheaper than other tours provided by tour companies), b) takes you to awesome locations known by locals, c) the tour guide is really nice and take photos for you while your at this beautiful scenic location! Anyway, I would recommend this place to anyone who likes to have fun and would like to see some special places in Oahu.

STAY HERE, it’s soooo much fun. I’ve stayed in a lot of hostels in Europe and none of them come close to this. Quick Summary:1. Clean2. Friendly staff3. Excellent tours4. Fun atmosphere, including hang out areas downstairs and a rooftop lounge 5. Good breakfast6. 4 minute walk from waikiki beach 7. Pizza party once a week upstairs for free I want to thank the entire staff, including Ashley, Praywa, Jarrett, Nora, another tall blonde girl whose name I can’t remember, Mike the tour guide, Will, and literally every other person working here for being super friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and just good solid awesome people. I stayed in a 4 person all female occupancy. Two women came and scrubbed the showers and bathrooms and little kitchenette clean every morning. Breakfast is from 7:45 to 9:00 am and it is fresh waffles, bread, butter, jam, peanut butter, coffee, tea, apples, and bananas. Perfect.Pizza party on the rooftop every Thursday.We drank on the rooftop and downstairs in the lobby and other seating areas and it was a blast. Staff told us about great local bars and told us how to get there. Have to leave the rooftop by 10 pm, but great pregame area.Every day there are INCREDIBLE tours by Mike. I recommend every single one. I did all of them and they were amazing. Super affordable, like 20-40 US dollars each. Unreal price for a 4-8 hour tour. That’s basically all I did.Hang out in the common areas. Talk to anyone. You’ll make friends and have a great time. Go in with a fun attitude and you’ll have a blast. Tip the staff. They don’t expect it and absolutely deserve it. I don’t know what else to say. I had such an awesome trip with zero planning by just doing the tours and making friends at the hostel. Nearby there are some Irish bars, a gay bar, a karaoke bar, and all kinds of other cute little spots. Great empanada truck right outside. You can rent surf boards, bikes, snorkel gear, etc from the hostel for very cheap. I can’t stress how dope this place is. I’m going back every time I go to Oahu.

This was hands down the best hostel I have ever stayed at!! I have stayed in hostels throughout Europe, USA and Asia, and none have come close to this hostel!! The managers, the travellers, the rooftop hangout, everything is amazing! Free breakfasts and pizza nights, clean rooms and wonderful staff, I cannot say enough good things about this place!Also, an extra special shout out to Mike, who runs the tours, thank you so much for showing me the very best Hawaii has to offer! I loved every minute of your tours! To anyone considering staying here, I cannot recommend it enough. And make sure you do the tours they offer with Mike. They are the best and cheapest way to see the island. Mike takes you around in an air conditioned bus, playing awesome tunes and providing wonderful insights to the tropical paradise all around you, tip him well!Thanks again, Mahalo! X

Staff were really friendly but we were unfortunate enough to share an apartment with a very ignorant and untidy guest which put our stay off to a bad start. The bathroom majorly needs updating. The aircon is also very noisy. The curtains don’t conceal the room so anyone at your window can see you changing. Breakfast was stressful with too many people making toast at one time and not being considerate to move on quickly to let others past. Not a place for me.

Had a phenomenal time at The Beach in Waikiki. The facilities were great, comfortable, and clean. There was a rooftop for everyone to get together and socialize. The best part was the tours with Mike, he took us to some of the best spots in O’ahu.

I stayed in this hostel for a week while travelling alone, and could not be happier with the experience. The bathrooms were the cleanest I have ever seen in a hostel, and even all the excess sand that was brought in from the beach was cleaned daily. They had plenty of outside space to hang towels and swim gear to dry, as well as outdoor seating outside of rooms. The staff were incredibly friendly and will always help include you if you feel lonely. Only downside is the rooftop shuts at 10 but that curfew is pretty universal and understandable, and everyone organises kick ons anyway. Shout out to Mike and his tour company that operates out of the hostel, always something to do every day of the week organised by the most experienced and friendly guy.

We had an amazing and unforgettable time in Oahu! This hostel was really cute and very close to the Waikiki beach. The rooms were very clean and we met many people from all over the world and made friends. The tours that are offered from the hostel every single day are just amazing and so much fun! We did 4 tours and we loved it so much! Mike was a really nice tour guide!!Would definitely recommend the hostel + the tours!- Aylin and Sevval

The hostel was just a few minutes away from waikiki beach. The free breakfast was good, the rooms were clean and the roof deck was great. I didnt liked, that there was no general room to eat together, you had to eat in front of sour rooms on the tables with your roommates, which was also nice but not that easy to get in touch with others.

Amazing hostel & location!! Great free breakfast and offer awesome tours. Staff are sooo helpful, when we had an issue with one of our roommates they laid out all of our options and we actually ended up with a very nice private room for very extra per night! Felt like a hotel room. Awesome stay thank you soo much!

This is my 2nd time staying here, I stayed here for 8 nights this time around. The hostel rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is super friendly and courteous. Never a dull day while I stayed, always some activity going on whether it be a day tour or just hanging around the hostel lounge/roof top area and getting to meet new people. It is in an ideal location, literally a 3 min walk to the beach.

I had an awesome week in the hostel! I traveled on my own and it was super easy to meet people. The tours the hostel offers were great and the location couldn’t have been any better! I would definitely recommend the hostel to anyone and definitely go back there!

Stay 9 nightsAlso close to WAIKIKI Beachyour service was very good, the accommodation and kitchen environment was very clean, and the service staff was very happy to help passengers with all the problems.I hope that next time I am still in Hawaii, I will stay at your hotel.

The hostel cleanliness, amenities, and rooftop are all super great etc but this review is about the difference the awesome staff made.There's a guy who works there named JEFF and he is AWESOME. I stayed for 6 nights with a friend in a semi-private room Very pleased with the room and facilities - very clean if a little bit stuffy.. Fantastic excursions run from the hostel (lovely Russian driver)and very reasonable. Position and staff very good and always very helpful. I worried that as a "mature" lady I might feel out of place but I was always made to feel very welcome. So convenient to explore Honololu and very close to the beach and buses as well. Definitely will stay there again next time I go to Hawaii. Thanks for a great time.

The best place to stay is Honolulu . wonderful people around and you feel like you are in a big friendly family :) and of course the ocean ,bars and store’s are 5 minutes away, great location. Love you The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel ! Thank you for best vacations

A very well organised, well located hostel! 2-3 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Staff are very friendly and on the same page as one and other. The rooms are secure, large and equip with a kitchenette and icy cold air conditioner. The rooftop is great to relax, meet other people & cook. This hostel has daily tours and activities around the island for a reasonable price. Free breakfast every morning & the occasional pizza night. I thought it was a slightly pricey accommodation initially. But in comparison to other accomodation in Honolulu, you really won’t find anything better for price.

The Beach hostel is an excellent place to stay for anyone who visits Hawaii. It's got a fantastic location and the star are exceptionally nice and helpful (especially Ashley ;). It was clean and well maintained. They have a variety of very reasonably priced excursions. 10/10 my favorite hostel I've been to. I'll definitely be visiting again in the future! Thanks for all the fun!

It was an amazing Hostel with amazing People. Clean, very helpful stuff and good breakfast. Best hostel I`ve ever stayed. Two blocks away from the beach and excellent Location. The trips from the hostel were amazing and defenetly worth it! Also had a fridge in my room which was perfect to cool some Drinks (and Food).

By far one of the best hostels I stayed at, they have daily activities/tours that are affordable and fun. Decent breakfast, friendly staff and great location! Rooms and bathrooms were cleaned daily. Def will be coming back!

I am so glad I picked this hostel to stay at. It was my first completely solo trip and was pretty nervous about location/ cleanliness/ safety/ etc. But, this place totally exceeded my expectations!!! From the moment I walked into the lobby, I was greeted by the manager, Yoshi, who had a huge smile on his face. It was great being able to travel on the island with people that were staying at the same hostel. Definitely made some great friends. Can't recommend this hostel enough!!!

What can I say that hasn’t been covered in previous reviews. The highlight of this hostel are definitely the staff! They are so friendly and keen to ensure you have the best trip possible. Not only that they are the one stop shop for all tours and activities but they give the best prices and value BY FAR. Yusik is the absolute man and helped make our two nights at the hostel a ton of fun. Breakfast was great and equipment rentals are awesome. Best hostel on the island!

I stayed here for 2 weeks last month. This was my first hostel experience and I must say, it was a great experience. Very nice hostel. Clean and tidy. Nice and secure.My partner and I stayed for about 11 days in Waikiki. We had a great time. review_body: This is the best hostel in Waikiki. The people you'll meet here are awesome, the staff is great (shout out to the manager Yushi who will give you the best tips for any place you go in O'ahu), breakfast is awesome (waffles, donuts, protein powder, coffee, fruit, toast, PB&J). Only a block from the beach. If you have a car you can park in Monsarrat Ave for free and walk to the hostel. The rooftop is the place to be when it's not raining. The MIX2 room is the best value for price if you want less noise in the room. You'll share the room with another person in an apartment setup (2 more rooms) with a common area in the building across the hostel. Some of those rooms even have private balconies. Great to meet people!

This hostel is not really as nice as the pictures make it look. In fact, the pictures on the website are completely false!! It's kind of like a run down motel. The air conditioning in my room was not working (it blew warm air), but it was never fixed, so it was super hot & uncomfortable in the room. The room was strange, with a kitchen right next to the beds. There was a stove that was unusable (not that I wanted to - just strange that it was there) & a large refrigerator right next to one of the beds, so not good if you needed to get something out while the person was sleeping there. The lockers were not full size & also very loud when you opened them. The bathroom was not very clean and the curtain actually came down, but no one came to fix that either. They have snorkel equipment you can borrow, but it never gets cleaned, so it's pretty disgusting. There are no real common areas in this place (there is a rooftop, but when it was actually open, no one was there) and no computers that the guests can use. Not a necessity, but would've been nice as my phone became waterlogged while I was there & I wasn't able to communicate or get any info. The staff was minimally helpful. It is right near the beach, but still a little further down the road from where most of the action is. I actually ended up switching to another hostel after a few nights.

Stayed in a semi private room, could not recommend it more as this hostel and their staff, especially Lushi, go out of their way to promote not only activities for people to meet, but also don’t use one preferred provider, but actually provide the activities themselves. Very central location and despite that, is quite quiet. You can be as social as you want, and the cross section usually there is awesome. Great experience

When arrived in Waikiki in the Friday morning checked in then straight to longboarding surfing & to my surprised the hostel had a Free Friday Night Pizza gethering. I stayed at The Beach Boutique for 10 nights (januari 2019) and it was such good experience. Yusik is by far the best hostel manager, very friendly and he will help you with anything. We had such an amazing time at this hostel! Everyone was so friendly! Every day activities, free pizza night, the breakfast is great and the room was very clean! Yushi did his best to accommodate me and my friends. Thank you so much for everything! MahaloAlessandra

This is a really cute place, warm, joyful and the location is great! The room was clean and nice. They are just on the beach of Waikiki. The reception is really nice. Best hostel I've ever stayed at! I accidentally booked a different hostel & Yusik pulled out all the stops to cater for me & staying here was the best decision! I would highly recommend for anyone considering to stay here to not hesitate and book! I usually don’t write reviews unless I’ve had a horrible or amazing experience. Best location ever- a block away from Waikiki beach and right beside the Marriot hotel so you know you saved a couple hundred bucks a night. review_body: This is the best hostel I've ever stayed at, hands down. The staff is nice and friendly and eager to make your trip fun and breezy. The vibe is great. The travelers here understand aloha too. It's easy to find things to do and people to do them with. The hostel also offers great tours ever day. Definitely take them up on it and do them! Also can't beat free pizza on Fridays and breakfast every morning. It's such a great deal. The location is perfect. It's only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Beds are comfy and bathrooms are cleaned daily. All around, great time, great place, great people!

This hostel is phenomenal not just for its location but for its sense of community as well. The beach is a 2 minute walk away, and the "upscale" part of Waikiki is just down the street. Very safe area. The dorm was clean and had renovated bathrooms with nice showers and tiling. Very comfortable place to stay.The staff at the hostel are phenomenal. They go out of their way to be welcoming and make things easy: they organize daily tours to various places around the island, have free pizza nights on Fridays, offer free rental for beach gear (boogie boards, mats, etc.), have free breakfast every morning with fresh waffles, and are just generally dedicated to their guests. The tour to Manoa Falls and the Lookout was great and a steal--only $10 (driver's tip) for what would have been several very costly Ubers. Every time I walked into the hostel reception area, I was warmly greeted by the staff person at the desk. The rooftop of the hostel is a great community spot with nice seating and string lights, and everyone gets together on the roof every night to drink, talk, and organize groups to go out to the bars or hit the beach. I was nervous to travel by myself for the first time and was concerned I wouldn't meet friends, but I found a great group of people to hang with and met new folks every day that I was there. If I return to Waikiki, I will definitely stay there again, and I will be recommending this hostel to anyone I know traveling to Honolulu.

It would difficult to find a better value hostel than this in Hawaii. The location in Waikiki is perfect. A minute walk to the beach with free beach gear or some for a small rental fee. The rooms were clean and the bathroom and showers were clean and hot. Yushi is very welcoming and helpful. The excursions organised each day are so useful to have at hand. If you’re staying in a hostel then this is as good as you’ll get.

The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel. As soon as we stepped into the doors we were greeted by the most amazing hosts, Yusik and Tim. We arrived way before check in time but they were so accommodating and friendly and helped organise our room straight away. There are daily activities organised for those staying in the hostel and everyone was encouraged to hang out and get to know each other. Not to mention the free pizza!!! To be quite honest this hostel made the trip that much mores amazing. Sometimes when you're on a vacation you look forward and count down the days until you go home. Not here, The Beach feels like a small family and the warmth of everyone makes you want to stay in Hawaii! (Not a bad thing at all). Thanks for the awesome stay and will definately see you again soon!

At Waikiki beach boutique hostel the employees are dedicated and friendly. It gives a warm homely feeling. Many activity to join everyday or just walk to the beach for surf, snorkel or chill.You can rent snorkel- or surfgear and borrow bodyboards for free at the hostel.

this is the best hostel you can ever get! The manager Yushi is a very friendly and nice host. The hostel offers different cheap trips to see something in Oahu. If you have any questions or problems Yushi is your man. He even let me place my luggage and use the showers for 5$, when I haven't had a room. A friend of mine didn't make the checkout in time, so they came and asked very friendly to hurry up. Thanks to Yushi and I will definitely come back :)

I love this hostel. I love the people that work here, I love the people that I met here! I enjoyed my stay so much and I'm absolutely sure I'll be back again. No better bang for your buck in Waikiki I think! I stayed in a 4 person mixed dorm. You have a fridge, microwave and ensuite bathroom. Great place for doing pre's in the evening. If you need to cook, there's also a kitchenette on the roof. Great place to make friends too. Breakfast is included, make sure you pile up on those waffles. Soooo good. Excursions are cheap and lots of fun. And there's a free pizza party every Friday night!The best thing is definitely the people though. Big props to Yushi. He is incredibly caring, wants all guests to have a wonderful stay, goes above and beyond for people and this man knows how to solve problems. His staff are all incredibly kind, friendly people who are always ready to help. This place also attracts the loveliest guests. Nearly all other guests while I was there were solo travellers with adventurous, fun and loving spirits. Best Christmas ever, couldn't ask for anything more. It was very memorable and something I'll cherish for a long, long time. Also, I was there for jimbo1285's birthday and the potluck dinner on Christmas and seeing the cakes come out was soooo incredibly sweet and touching. They even brought out leis for them. We all had a happy, lovely night together. Yushi and the crew, thank you so much for taking good care of us and making sure we have lots of fun! Take care and see you soon! xoxo

I spent 3 nights here on a last minute trip to Honolulu for Christmas/Birthday. The location in Waikiki was extremely convenient as it was roughly 1 block away from the beach with multiple shops around within walking distance.  I stayed in an 6 person dorm room as this was something that I booked online but there are also 4 person rooms and private rooms. Beds in dorm rooms are not assigned so its first come first serve in the rooms for beds. Rooms also had a full size fridge to help keep the beer cold. All have ensuite bathrooms. Rooms all had AC and were comfortable. Cleaning staff comes every morning to sweep the room and do a quick clean in the bathroom. My only thing is that I wish there were hooks in the bathroom to hang towels or clothes. The floors do get wet and sandy as many people are coming back from the beach. Not a places to hang clean clothes or towel before showering other then putting on the toilet seat cover or floor. But overall still a very comfortable room.Now the staff are AMAZING!! All were so helpful with answering any question guest may have about things to do or eat in Oahu. The hostel itself also has many daily tours to different part of the island. Its a great way to meet other guest staying at the hostel. The staff also are great at hosting events to help get everyone together as they hosted a pot luck on Christmas day. I thought that was just amazing how many people it got together that evening. Many people starts the evening on the rooftop drinking and hanging out with other guest till the it closes at 10pm then moves on to a local bar. The rooftop is a great way of meeting other guest from the hostel.Staying at this hostel was one my best experiences ever comparing to the other hostels Ive stay in around the world. There are nicer hostels out there but the experience at this one I will never forget. Yushi the manager knew it was my birthday on Christmas day along with another guest at the hostel. Yushi along with a few other guest got together and surprised us with birthday cakes at the pot luck. I was so grateful for this as all the other guest were there to celebrate my birthday along with the other guest as well. This made it such an memorable birthday and Christmas for myself. I will definitely be back!

I spent 9 days in Waikiki at the hostel.The stay was wonderful. Staff especially gm yusik Hong goes above and beyond anyone I’ve met in order to make guests enjoy their time.If I ever return to Honolulu I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

Stayed at Waikiki Boutique for about week in December 2018 and I can say this is the best hostel I have ever stayed in hands down. Yushi and the whole staff are incredible. The vibe there is amazing and the people that stay in the hostel are pretty cool too. Location is pretty good, near the beach and restaurants, and they offer different tours every day which is pretty good cuz in days you don't want to plan much they will do it for you. Variety of rooms so you can choose whether you want to share with a lot of people or not. Rooms are kept clean on a daily basis too. You will definitely have an amazing stay here!

I stayed at the hostel for 1 week during early December 2018. It was my first time in Hawaii and I was by myself, the staff however was very friendly and made my stay a lot easier. I was given suggestions, locations and a lot of local knowledge. My favorite staff member was Yasmin who was very kind and patient with me especially on my last night. I highly recommend the hostel, the location is great and the people I met there really gave me a good experience.

Greeted by Yushi and Kendra with smiles all round and a positive vibe, The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel is the one to choose, the vibe is relaxed and the customer service is on point, led by the manager Yushi.It’s close to Denny’s and Lulus and usually has parking available.Wifi is good also and a rooftop chillout spot ✌️ Thanks

I stayed at this hostel for 12 nights. The staff is super friendly and really want you to have a good time. One employee even got me earplugs when I told him I had a hard time falling asleep. My 4-bed dorm got cleaned every morning and the bathroom was equipped with a good shower. The people that stay at the hostel are nice! I enjoyed the company of my roommates. The location was perfect for me: close to the beach, bus stop, restaurants, food trucks and I could walk to Diamond Head for the actual hike. The hostel lets you borrow beach gear (mats, body boards, chairs etc.) for free. The trips they organize are free - you only pay 10/20 dollars to tip the driver. I enjoyed the free pizza on Friday evenings and the free breakfast.Downsides to staying here: my room was close to the reception and I could literally hear everything people were saying outside. The room smells a bit like mould. I guess the rooms are challenging to ventilate and people bringing in wet/dirty clothes does not help either. I knew Hawaii is expensive, but having to pay extra for doing your laundry and renting surf/paddle boards is a bit too much for me. I also found it a bit strange that I had to make my own bed when I arrived. When I hung my bathing suit outside to dry it was gone the next day :( But that is not really something the hostel is responsible for I guess...Overall, this is the best place to stay in Waikiki on a budget. You will have a great stay here!

It was my first time out in Hawaii and I ended up staying at 4 different hostels with my 2 friends. The Beach Waikiki Boutique hostel was, without a doubt, the best of all four. Yushi, the manager was so kind and friendly and he does an amazing job running the place. The rooms were sparkling clean, the beds were comfy, and the social atmosphere was awesome. They have a rooftop where everyone goes up to at night to hangout and get to know each other and it was just a really great experience overall. We met a lot of great people and even ended up going on hikes with some of them. I would 100% recommend staying here if you're going to be in Honolulu!

For someone who is new to traveling and staying in hostels, The Beach Waikiki Boutique offered me an experience that was way above what I had previously received in the hostels before it. The staff were amazing, friendly and attentive to my group's needs. The rooms themselves were well maintained and inviting, as well as the communal areas, which offered a ton of fun activities for those staying there. When you think of community, you can't get better than what this hostel offers, whether that's the group tours and hikes that are masterminded by Yushi, or the Pizza Party night each week, there isn't a place that does it better. The staff are so incredibly engaging and kind, it's hard not to feel like you are visiting your friends when you come and visit this place.We extended multiple times, for multiple nights, and it was an easy decision. We look forward to going back, and strongly recommend this hostel to travelers who are deciding where to stay in Waikiki.

During my time here in Hawaii, I stayed at 3 different hostels from the start. However, The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel stood at more than any hostel I've ever stayed at in my life! Not only was the price of the hostel outstanding, but the staff exceeded more than any expectation I've ever had. The location of the hostel was perfect too. Loved this place! =)

We knew before we even booked a room at this place that it was going to be our favorite hostel to have stayed at during Rove's maiden voyage into the world as a fledgling company.The surrounding area has several other hostels and we toured each of them in succession before arriving at the The Beach Waikiki Boutique and once we did, we of course didn't need to book anywhere else.From the friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating manager Ushi who was there to answer any question or concern to the amazing community, that while obviously rotates with the coming and going of travelers, always seems to be tempered by that generous and comfortable spirit and attitude of The Beach Waikiki itself - it all culminated into one of the best experiences I've ever had at a Hostel.The Beach Waikiki will from this point forward will act as a golden measuring stick with which I'll compare any future hostel stay in any location. My only concern is that the bar has been set so high I will never find another place that can hold a candle to this bright, radiant spot in Waikiki.

This is best hostel I've stayed at, I've been there 3 times for a total of 24 days in the last year. Every time I return it feels like coming home, only better!The manager, Yushi, could not do a better job of running the place. He does everything to ensure you have a good stay and goes way above and beyond what anyone would expect, for instance one morning some guests couldn't get Uber to work so he just let them use his car for the day!The other workers are also great, Tim is a fantastic number 2, Paul has a certain New Jersey charm and Kendra is fun to talk to at night. The hostel is clean and secure and the location could not be better.It's also very easy to meet others by signing up for the daily shuttles around the island, or just hanging on the rooftop at night.I love spending time here and will be back.

Amazing experience staying at this hostel, I was their for only 4 nights but I had an incredibly time,staff was amazing environment was awesome, location is perfect just a few blocks from the beach and zoo, free breakfast daily and free pizza on Friday night! Can’t wait to book another trip here. Love this place! Mahalo

This Hostel is just amazing!The Staff is great! They are always friendly and give many great tips. The rooms are big and clean.the tours are great and you can rent almost everything at the hostel (surfboard, snorkel equipment ect ...)I recommend this hostel to everyone.

This place is truly the best hostel I've ever stayed at. Yushi tries really hard to make you feel at home and to make sure you have the best time possible. The rooms are very clean and the beds are great. The roof has a nice big lounge area and did I already mention the free pizza? And the great breakfast? I'll definitely come back. Yushi, Yasmine and Tim you made this hostel feel like home in a crazy city on the other side of the world. ❤️

Really nice hostel, perfectly located in Waikiki, with clean rooms and individual bathroom per dorm.There's free breakfast, activities available every day and free pizzas on Friday night.In the evening, everyone meet up on the roof and the whole thing has a really good vibe.Special shout out to Yushi for running the place so well and being a really cool guy.You can't go wrong going there if you're looking for a place in Waikiki.

Fantastic hostel! One of the best I've stayed in. The team there were wonderful and couldn't do more to help you. Heaps of cheap tours every day of the week to explore Oahu with other hostel people. Free pizza night!! Stayed in a 4 bed female dorm which was great, had our own bathroom and the room was cleaned daily. Loved my time here and would 100% recommend it to anyone wanting to have fun and meet lots of new people

We stayed for about a week and we really enjoyed it! Really helpful and super friendly staff, fun breakfast (loved the waffles!) and great location. Room was clean and nice too. We would always stay there again if we were to come back!

The Beach waikiki was the BEST hostel I have ever stayed at! Everything was perfect! The staffs are always willing to help you and talk with you making you feel more secure (in case you are traveling alone for example); they also promote many activities like pizza night, movie night, games at the rooftop, chocolates at the reception just to make us getting together and have a good time. I met great people there mostly because of all of the facilities that they provide. I strongly recommend it!Already missing my stay there :)

Hey There, this was one of my best stays in Hawaii, if not the best!! On my first two night i got upgraded into a semi privat room (before i had booked an mixed dorm) , the staff is very very friendly and cool! When you have any problems with a room, or it is fully booked out, they will always help you and find the best solution for someone!✌ Thank you like i said to the GM Yushi and all the Other staff ;) very very cool people, tho!After i came back from kauai, they got me and a friend upgraded into a cabana suite, which was soo cool to have like a real nice doublebed for yourself! Now i‘m in a normal dorm, and it‘s very clean good, too! So all the rooms, they have are amazing, cool people around, cool vibe, best costumer service i‘ve had so far, really really good daily tours organised from the hostel, free pizza night on friday! Amazing!!

I was traveling solo and my friend had highly recommended this hostel in Waikiki. The room was spacious, clean, and having an ensuite bathroom is wonderful. The rooftop area was also very nice for nighttime. As great as the room/hostel was, the best part of this hostel for me was the amazing trips offered daily by the hostel. They organize transportation for you to some of Oahu's best spots. I met a lot of amazing people this way. The staff were all SO friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to make us all have a great time. I really hope to come back one day! Thank you!

I stayed here the 1st week of october and kept extending my stay because I was having such a great experience. The staff is nice and helpful. I never felt uncomfortable being a solo female traveler. The rooms were nice and cleaned daily. I stayed in the 4 female dorm room. My room had a bathroom and some cupboards with a kitchen sink, microwave and refrigerator which came in handy for leftovers or groceries. They offer breakfast which consisted of white and wheat bread, peanut butter, jelly, butter, apples, bananas, white powdered donuts, freshly made waffles, coffee & tea. They also offer free daily tours that you just need to tip the driver. Eugene is awesome and is really good at giving the tours, he is a wealth of knowledge. They have a rooftop area with a kitchen, bathroom, patio furniture, TV and some cozy hammocks. Oh and how can I forget they even have free WiFi. This is so close to the beach, Honolulu Zoo, Denny's, Starbucks, many other eateries and the bus stop is around the corner too. I met so many cool travelers and easily made a ton of friends here. I love this place!

The hostel was seriously amazing! First, all the staff was so kind and happy to answer all of our questions according to restaurants, bars, activities, etc. You can see that the employees are all happy with their job and make their best for the guests to enjoy their time. Second, the rooms are very clean and bigger than other hostels we tried. They have chairs and beah gear you can use for free, the breakfast was good and they have a beautiful commune area on the rooftop. Dont go elsewhere, this hostel is the best really!

I had an amazing time at this hostel. Without a doubt is the best hostel in Waikiki. Breakfast is great with a lot of option (not only bread like most of the hostels ). People here are great, I met a lot of travelers and did activities with them which is really important when you travel alone. The staff is amazing and super friendly. They organize tours every day which is great to meet people, and get to see the island for a cheap price. I would def stay again!

My first stay at a hostel-and I couldnt have picked a better one! I stayed 6nights.Rooms are cleaned everyday.Breakfast is delicious.Staff is amazing.As a Female solo traveller I felt safe all the time.Very easy to meet new folks, especially on the daily (cheap) exkursions to different part of the island!

For interaction the hostel is great. They organise low cost excursions which help you mix with other travellers. You can also use snorkeling gear and beach mats at reception. The room itself was ok, air con wasn’t great depending on which bed you get. Avoid top bunks if possible. Lockers are small and some broken. Bathrooms are nice. Hostel is located a few blocks from the beach. ABC stores are everywhere so necessities are close by and there are large fridge freezers in the rooms to store food. Would stay again

Stayed 4 nights and met some amazing people from all over the world. They do daily excursion trips for just the cost of a driver's tip!! Just do it, it is within walking distance to so many things to do!

I stayed in September not knowing how a hostel experience would be. So glad I did it. Everyone there from the staff to the people staying there are just to chill and happy. Free food in the morning, great communal environment. Free boogie boards, snorkels, beach chairs and other things for taking to the beach! All week long they take trips to must see destinations for those who don't have cars. 5 star amenities for hostel pricing! lol. My room was Clean and well kept, better than many hotels! What the heck! I feel I got really lucky with this place. Coming back for sure who needs an overpriced hotel! Oh and its a block away from the water you just can't ask for more.

Small and cramped rooms. Nowhere to put your stuff & worse when full. Stove & micro in room but off limits. Lights shine in the face & really hot on top bunk. Workers know very little about the island & made stuff up. I've been to Hawaii several times & knew some info given was wrong. The breakfast kitchen cramped & hot. Also, the worst flatmates, so rude but not the hostels fault. I did like the age diversity but the hostel, not so much.

I've stayed in this hostel on two different occasions and both experiences have been great. The staff are very friendly, helpful and there's someone at the front desk 24 hours. Hostel offers a shuttle to various trips around the island and will host events throughout the week. The hostel room are well kept and clean. This is a great hostel for first timers travelers.

Ideal option for a solo traveller/first-time traveller to Hawaii. Can get a shuttle direct from the airport to the hostel, rooms are clean and spacious, it's easy to meet fellow travellers in ample communal spaces and at the free breakfast the hostel puts on, the hostel staff are very friendly and will help you organise yourself on the hostel-organised trips or through other guests with cars etc! All in all a great place to stay, highly recommended!

This hostel is perfect for staying in Waikiki on a budget. Great location, walking distance from the beach and shops/restaurants. Friendly and informative staff, who give great advice about the local area and arrange trips every day to different parts of the island.Great resources, they surfboards and body boards for rent from the hostel.We stayed in a private room, which was in a building across the road, which was shared between 3 rooms and had a nice common area :)

First up, I'm probably not really the target market for this accommodation as I was traveling for a conference, so take that into consideration, I guess. I stayed here for three nights in a semi private room. PROS - The staff were super nice as everyone says, and the bedroom size was fine. The tours looked to be awesome value, but unfortunately I didn't have time to take any. The breakfast was ok; not amazing, but it did the job. The location is very good. Close to the breach and at the quieter end of Waikiki. It's easy to use the public bus from this accommodation. CONS - The airconditioning was right above my head and pretty noisy, and there was no way to get fresh air into the room. I really didn't like that there was no soap to wadh hands after using the bathroom. The shower didn't feel very clean, but at least it smelled like bleach and they did change the bath mat each day. OVERALL I probably would stay there again, mainly because Waikiki is so crazy expensive!

Great option for the budget traveler in Waikiki. The staff are super friendly, the location is right next to the beach/downtown area, and the hostel has a lot of activities to see the island and meet other travelers. The room is basic, but has A/C and is cleaned daily. I would recommend ear plugs and a sleeping mask, but that's important for any hostel environment.

The Hostel is located in a very nice area, the beach is just around the corner, the bus stop is also near the hostel. We were staying in a Semi private bedroom, so we had enough privacy, but were sharing a kitchen and a bathroom. The room was clean enough, but the first night we noticed some cockroaches in the bathroom, that was a bit unpleasant. But the next day they disappeared, so someone must have cleaned there. So after the first night the bathroom was perfectly fine.The stuff in the hostel is very friendly and easygoing. A great thing about the hostel are the trips that they are organizing every day! You just pay the driver´s tip and can get to beautiful places without worrying about a car or public transport!We also enjoyed the simple breakfast on the nice rooftop!

The hostel was absolutely amazing, clean and close to the beach and most of the convenient stores. The staff are friendly and very helpful. They are always ready to assist. Thank you for making my trip memorable ❤️

This hostel is honestly the best bang you will ever get for your buck. It is in a prime location, affordable, good quality rooms and they have other little perks like free body board rentals or shuttle services throughout the island in exchange for little tip! Staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. Cleaners stop by every day. The whole vibe is very welcoming and relaxed.Stayed here two years ago, stayed again this year. Planning on coming back if I stop by Oahu !!

Myself and a friend had been travelling around USA for a few weeks and Hawaii was our final destination. We spotaneously booked at The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel and our experience was nothing short of the BEST hostel experience I have had. I’ve been to many hostels in America, Europe and Australia and none of these have left me feeling as welcomed and had such an enjoyable stay. The hostel offers day trips to many of the islands best attractions all for free! Throughout the hostel there is swimming gear from floaties to surfboards to borrow/hire. Friday’s they provide free pizza and every morning there is breakfast available for all guests. Every guest I came in contact with felt the same and the hostel encouraged such a social environment it was so easy to make friends, the hostel was filled with all kinds of guests of different ages and countries. I was fortunate enough to stay in both a private room and a mixed dorm, both of which were fantastic - cleanliness, comfort and space alike. The staff were the best, there was nothing they couldn’t help with and were always so understanding of all guests no matter the circumstance. I couldn’t recommend this hostel enough to anyone looking for accommodation in Waikiki and I hope that my travels somehow end back in Hawaii so I can stay with The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel again!

This hostel was fantastic! The rooms had a full size fridge, the beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked well during the hot nights! They offer various tours around the island, much much cheaper than you'll pay with the various tour companies. They also have social nights and the staff are super helpful with recommendations of things to do and see. And breakfast is included! Thanks Yushi and the team for such a great stay.

Stayed here in July 2018 and when I arrived I was greeted very friendly. Guy behind the counter had great information about what to do and where to go, I forgot his name but he was very funny and made me feel very welcome. I stayed in a private double room with own bathroom. the room was big, clean and had a very good airconditioning and that is something you will definitely need when staying in Hawaii. The hostel is a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach where you can swim safely. the hostel also provided clean towels and if, like me, will arrive with a jetlag I suggest booking a Robert's Hawaii shuttlebus in advance, they are not that expensive and drop you off at the front door of your stay. I loved this place and would go back. The hop-on hop-off trolley bus stand is a minute walking away.

Located in walking distance to the famous Waikiki beach, offering dorms with A/C and including breakfast in the morning. Excursions are arranged as well. As much as I was longing for a little more nightlife after having been on some remote islands, having people coming in and out of the dorm at night I found irritating. For this reason I never really settled in well at this place.

Stayed at this hostel for 2 weeks..This hostel was awesome ! Great vibes and full of friendly people and staff ( actually saw the manager lend a guest 100$ because he ran out of money ) ! Would stay again!

I can't be happier about choose this hostel in Waikiki. The rooms have plenty space, in suite bathroom and a fridge. So basically you feel like in home. The location is perfect, just one block to get to the beach and a walking distance for everything in Waikiki. Yusik at the reception helped me a lot with everything I wanted to know about Oahu, tours, activities. Thank you very much for helping me to achieve all the tours and experiences there! I would choose to stay there if I go back to Hawaii in the future.
