Lovely private rooms, great breakfast donuts, nice shared areas and free pizza on a Friday. What’s more to like?! This is a great little hostel in an ideal location and is fantastic for a short break on Oahu.

I have stayed here 3 different times and enjoyed myself so much. I have made what will be life long friends with roommates I had from each stay. For a hostel, this place is awesome. First it's clean. Second, the staff is friendly and helpful. The total vibe at this place is awesome. They have group meals twice a week on the rooftop patio. Which is a great way to meet new people from all over the world. The beach is 2 blocks away. There is a Starbucks and 2 ABC stores within 2 blocks. Great location and nice clean, decent rooms.

This place has everything you could ask for and more! It’s very clean, quiet, friendly vibe, has free breakfast everyday and free pizza on fridays! Air conditioning and kitchen in each room, beach equipment for use, free tours everyday, etc. It literally has it all and for such an amazing price. You’re definitely missing out if you don’t stay here! Yushi is also fantastic in helping you out with whatever you need. However, my one and only complaint are Yushi’s lame dad jokes ;)

I'm a solo traveler and stayed at the 2-bed room in the building across the street for 6 days. Room was clean and had perfectly working AC. It had refrigerator just outside the room for you to store your drinks and food. They had kitchen downstairs if you want to cook and also had common area to have sit and relax. The main building had a lounge at the rooftop for you to hangout/chat with other fellow travelers from all around the world! Staffs at the reception desk was super helpful and very chill. It's only about 5 minute walk to the Waikiki beach which was great. Don't miss the pizza on Friday evening! They also offers shuttle service to many attractions of the island with $10-$20 tips so if you are not planning to renting a car, this is a great option to explore the island. I would love to come back to stay here again!

Best place to stay if travelling on a budget. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Genuinely want you to have the best experience possible. The manager offered us free coffee and even gave us a Starbucks gift card! So lovely!! They offer tours all around Oahu that are exclusive for hostel guests and you only have to pay the driver tip ($10-$20usd - so cheap). The rooms and facilities are kept clean. Central location. Really great place to stay if you’re looking to experience Waikiki or Oahu on a budget! Will definitely stay here again next time!

Me and my partner stayed for 6 nights in a 6dorm and we couldn't been any happier with our stay. Staff is super friendly and very very helpful. Rooms are very spacious, AC works perfectly, every room has lockers, massive fridge outside in front of every room and cleaners came every morning. This hostel is super central and just 2 min to the beach We would recommend this hostel to anyone Big thank you to the team for making us so welcome. See you next time

Had an amazing stay at The Beach. The location is perfect, within a 5 minute walk to the most beautiful beach you will ever see. The hostel is also within walking distance of delicious restaurants and the main tourist strip, so all the amenities are at your fingertips. The hostel also arranges awesome day trips so that you don't just have to stay in the tourist area. I would highly recommend doing all the day trips, you get to see Oahu in a a fun and authentic way. Everyone at the front desk is super helpful and awesome to talk to if you have a chance. Already planning my next trip to the beach, thanks for an awesome trip!

I couldn't recommend this place enough! The location is right down the road from the beach and a short walk to the main strip of Waikiki. The room was spacious and clean and breakfast with coffee was a real treat. ALL staff are super accomodating and friendly especially the manager Yushi who is very knowledgeable about Oahu and keen to help with all questions! This hostel really made my stay in Waikiki that much better!

This hostel has a great location a short walk from the beach. The rooms are clean and nice and the free breakfast is awesome including fresh waffles and muffins! There are transfer tours on offer every day. I can personally recommend the north shore and the hanuma bay ones as great choices. Don’t bother with the pearl harbour one you can do that one your own. NOTE- the tours are just a driver dropping you off places so don’t come expecting a guided tour it’s simply transport. This said tho it’s convenient and cheap. I will definitely stay here again!!

Had a 16 hour day layover and wanted an affordable place to shower, nap and store our luggage in Waikiki. I emailed in advance requesting early check-in should it be possible. We arrived by city bus ($2.50 and bustop 1 block away) at 7:30 and Yushi at the front desk had upgraded us to a private room from a semi private as it was available right away! We checked out at 5 so they could clean the room and resell it for the night...we offered, were not asked to at all! They hold luggage and offer have a shower as well.Really, really good value, exceptional service, fantastic location...will be back! BTW Yushi... maybe offer a $25/day "facility use fee" for a day pass for kitchen, shower, luggage hold... We would snap that up and leaves you with your rooms for the nights as well!

This hostel was a fun place to stay. They have a pizza night social every friday night at no cost. The manager Yushi is laid back and friendly, as are all the staff. It is located a block from waikiki. You cant beat the price for the location. They have free rentals of beach gear and boogie boards.There are waffles and muffins and coffee in the morning. There is a nice patio rooftop where guests gather in the evening to socialize.

Stayed here for 3 nights last weekend and was in the private room in the 3rd floor. Was grateful for the air conditioner but got chilly at night with only a sheet provided. Nice large fridge compared to other hotel rooms. Didn’t have the continental breakfast provided so can’t review that. Front desk clerks were very nice and helpful. A little bit of walk to get into heart of Kalākaua Blvd but quiet at night (although wouldn’t walk around Waikiki too late anymore). Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

This was one of the best hostels I've ever stayed at. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and comfortable, great location, awesome atmosphere & all the staff were amazing. Cannot wait to stay here again. Thanks guys!

I stayed here for about a week. The staff we’re all lovely, welcoming and helpful whenever you asked for information on the island, car hire, day trips etc. rooms are cleaned once a day in the morning. Each shared room had its own ensuite. I got to meet some cool people through this hostel. Their days trips are brilliant too and bus stops are close by as well as car hire via hotels next door too. Air con and breakfast was a bonus, even pizza night. Thank you all for having me. I’ll def recommend you to any of my travel buddies in future. Suggestion: a share board where people can write notes if they wanting to share car hire/hitch a ride/Uber share to airport etc...heard you used to have one, reckon you should bring it back and pop it up at reception or kitchen area. Thanks again for everything

I loved staying at this hostel. Our room (women only, 4 beds) was clean. The staff, especially Yushi, is so friendly and helpful, and housekeeping does a great job. I enjoyed the tours they organize (great value), the pizza night, the boogie boards they lend out for free ... The location is also very good. Bring a lock, so you can keep your valuables in a safe.

Travelling solo I was so happy to see they offered cheap amazing tours. From hiking to snorkeling. Cleaning staff comes every 2 mornings but the place could use a deep cleanse. The staff are super friendly and free breakfast has waffles! Seems pricey but it was worth it.

This place is nice and clean, and one of the few hostels with AC. The people there are so nice, it’s almost like they’re family. The rooms are clean and the beds sleep nice. When I was here in the middle of June 2018, there were only nice and fun people over here. I had the time of my life! This is the place you want to go, this is the only hostel that matters!I want to give a special shout out to Ruen and Shay for all the good care. You guys made this trip the best one I’ve had in years.

A great place to stay when visiting the island! We stayed in our own room with shared kitchen and bath with no issues. Staff were very accommodating, the rooms were clean, the beach is just around the corner and the hostel offers lots of activities.

First ever hostel experience and it was incredible. The staff was friendly and helpful. Yushi and Ruen are AWESOME! I recommend taking one of the tours to hikes/beaches, I met a lot of amazing people through those. The rooms were clean and air conditioned. And the hostel is a block and a half from the beach. You honestly cannot beat it. I will 100 percent stay in this hostel again next time I visit Hawaii.

Super cool hostel, such good vibes, had such a laugh with other guests and the amazing staff! I felt at home right away. Rooms are all cleaned daily, super good wifi, comfy beds, brilliant facilities such as the free body board hire and snorkel epuiment, they also have super cheap surf hire, free breakfast is lush. I loved free pizza Fridays. Definitely recommend this hostel to anyone staying in Waikiki, I thought it was the best of the lot! Thankyou so much Beach Boutique for my perfect Hawaiin experience!

I have nothing but great things to say about this place. We stayed here for 18 days and 18 nights, and it was extremely hard to leave. For context, I'm a 22 year old guy and was traveling with a friend the same age. I've stayed in hostels in Southeast Asia, New Zealand, Australia, and Mexico as well as higher end resorts/hotels around the Caribbean, Brazil, and California. From day one, the hostel manager was extremely friendly and helpful, providing us with a discount that we had read about online. All of the hostel staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about the things to do around Oahu - from hikes, to surf spots, car rentals, and camping spots. We became part of the family and really felt at home. Outside of the amazing company, the hostel amenities themselves were great. We stayed in a semi-private for a great rate. The kitchen worked well and we cooked family style meals a few times during our stay (ABC stores located within 2 minutes and a Safeway within a 20 minute walk). The AC was awesome and the showers were great. Our sink broke one day and it was immediately fixed without us even mentioning it. The hostel also provides a lot of great beach stuff for free (boogie boards, beach mats, umbrellas, etc). The location is incredible. 5 minute walk from the beach, near a moped/car rental spot, and close enough to the center of Waikiki. We hiked a ton and the hostel wasn't too far from the famous hikes as well as from the less frequented ones on All Trails. There are bus stops near by when you don't feel like Ubering. To explore the rest of the island we went on the hostel trips (they only require you tip the driver, which still makes it a LOT cheaper than going on other tours and allows you to meet people at the hostel - we made a lot of friends - from 20 year olds to 60 year olds and also encountered those who didn't want to socialize, which was cool too). The rest of the island is also easily accessible by car. We rented cars a couple of days and made it around the island and back within the day.The manager is extremely timely and will bend over backwards to make sure that you're having the best experience ever. I've never experienced such great camaraderie and hospitality at a hostel. The rooftop is a really nice spot to hangout at. There are a couple of hammocks if you don't want to be bothered, and then some seating space where we often sat and hung out, drinking some beers in great company. Since we stayed for a while, we saw the hostel at highs and lulls - there were times where Free pizza night on Fridays had no seating room and others where only a handful of people showed up. Through it all the atmosphere was upbeat but light. If it's not obvious by now, I couldn't recommend this hostel more. Whenever I return to Oahu, I'll for sure be staying there again. To the Beach Waikiki Boutique Staff - thank you so much for the hospitality, great service, advice, and above all friendship. Hope to see some familiar faces if I return in the near future.

The hostel is super affordable!Has a lot of day trip options for all around Oahu such as hiking and snorkeling all at a reasonable price! The staff were very friendly and had a lot of suggestions for what to do. The location is fairly central and only a few minutes walk to the beach. Rooms are nice and not crowded. Breakfast was basic but waffles were amazing! Loved it!

I had a great time! The location is awesome and the staff really friendly and helpful! I can absolutely recommend! The price is fair and you can meet a lot of great people. It’s not loud although it’s at so awesome located!

I stayed for a long Memorial Day weekend trip, and found it to be a decent alternative to hotels that seem to keep getting more expensive each year I visit Honolulu, and that have amenities I don't use. I had a semi-private room (full size bed + twin with a shared bathroom and common area with a desk and fridge). If you are into social activities, this is a brilliant choice as there are tours that go daily for $10 or $20 to places around the island, Friday pizza night etc. The place is 3 blocks from the beach! I did none of the activities and basically used this place as a crash pad. My room was tidy and appeared recently renovated with fresh paint, etc. My full size mattress was extremely soft with slippery microfiber sheets that were impossible to stay put. The twin mattress was a bit saggy when sat on. The A/C blew ice cold. Wifi was fast and I had no issues connecting to my work VPN on it. No safe or locker, but the room had a lock on the door. The bathroom appeared recently redone as well, and was clean aside from some worrisome brown stuff on the shower ceiling (mold maybe?).In the end it a tidy, safe and reasonably comfortable place. If you are seeking a bargain on a place close to the beach, give this one a shot. I'm not sure if I'll be back, maybe if conventional hotels are too expensive to my liking yet again when I come back to Honolulu, or need a little bit more privacy.Recommendation for management: check out the ceiling of the shower rooms... mine looked a bit sketchy. And invest in some cotton sheets, they don't have to be fancy.

I choose this hostel because of the great location and for the reviews I read about it and I couldn’t choose a better place to stay. I went there on vacation with 2 other friends and we all loved our stay.Rooms are great, with private bathroom and at least on mine we had a balcony with chairs and table, was great to chill. There’s also fridges available in the rooms.Location is really excellent, close to the beach, stores, restaurants and bars. They also offer breakfast, free tours everyday (you only pay tip to the driver), free pizza on Friday and I love how they have a lot of stuff that we can borrow for free including chairs to the beach.Staff is a big plus, they’re very friendly and willing to help.Extra points for Tim for always being so friendly, Yushi for making our mornings so fun and Rio for being the fun spirit of the night, we wouldn’t even leave the hostel just to be chatting and laughing with him!I highly recommend this hostel,Mahalo for everything!

Stayed here for 4 nights in a private room. It was basically a room with a queen bed in An apartment with three rooms with a separate bathroom and shower in the common area. It was cheaper than any of the hotels in the area and I was not going to be staying inside very much but wanted my own room. It definitely fit the budget and was very comfortable! Would stay here again!

We had a wonderful experience! The location was great, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and we met so many people from around the world. The room was very comfortable and clean. I loved that we had our own fridge and bathroom (shared between four people). The free lawn chairs and boogie boards were greatly appreciated. Free pizza on Friday night was great. It was a good opportunity to meet people and there was plenty of food to go around. Breakfast is pretty much all carbohydrates, but it was still appreciated and coffee was also available. Common kitchen was very basic, but it worked. The tours may be better described as a ride with directions, but for the price they were great. It was a good way to meet people and explore the island (much more time efficient than city transit). All in all, an excellent place. The staff are a big part of what makes this place so inviting. They couldn’t be more helpful.

The Waikiki Boutique hostel was a very big part of why I enjoyed my trip in Hawaii. My first impression was how clean and cozy it felt. The AC also made the stay much more comfortable as I know some hostels don't always offer it. The free pizza and daily breakfast was a great bonus as well. Not only that but the beach is so close by but they also offer tours so there is always something to do in or out the hostel. A big thank you to the staff who make the place feel like home. I especially want to thank Yasmin and Yushi for their hospitality and for always putting a smile on my face! I would recommend this hostel to anyone as they have so much to offer. Your stay here will be eventful and unforgettable!

We stayed at this hostel for 4 nights in mid March. The 10$ tours are juste perfect, having know that, I would not have done so many researchs for hike and tours. The saff are little gem of persons. Always patient and smiling to help. The rooftop is great though everytime we went there, there was nobody, too bad for that. They have a blackboard that is refresh more than 2 times in the week to let you know the good and cheap place to go have a drink or eat or any event worth going. They rent for free or for really cheap snorkeling gear, boogie board, beach towels/games/mat/etc. and even surf board. The breakfast are ok considering they are free! The place was the only reason I liked Waikiki, «the other Tokyo with a beach». Oh and have a political talk with Eugene, the Chauffeur! He is one kind of a legend! :)

Stayed here during my visit on Oahu with a friend and it’s a great hostel that i will definitely stay at again if i ever come back. We’re on a 2 month long trip and this is one of the best hostels so far. You get a complimentary breakfast which is actually really good compared to other hostels. The staff is great too and will always try to help. Except for one guy who could be grumpy sometimes.. They have tours to different places on Oahu for 10-20 dollars which is also a great way to get to meet the other people staying there! They also have free pizza nights on fridays up on the rooftop where they order pizza from Dominos. The rooms are very clean and fresh and we stayed in both dorms and a private room. The dorms have their own bathroom with a shower and there’s also a fridge and a small freezer in the room which i thought was great! We also stayed at The Polynesian hostel due to this place being full but that was nothing to compared to this place, we came back here as soon as we could even though it’s a bit more pricey it’s definitely worth it!!My only ”complaint” would be to have better lighting on the rooftop.But all in all it’s a great hostel with a great vibe and i’ve been recommending it to everyone we’ve been meeting here in Hawaii.Ps. Yushi in the reception - the two swedes who didn’t have anything planned for the big island are fine, we got a jeep and absolutely loved the big island! Thanks for all the recommendations :)

Great typical backpacker hostel with awesome free breakfast (waffles!, chocolate and blueberry muffins, toast, good coffee) and super nice staff. They offer tours to many tourist destinations, which are free, you just have to give the driver a 10 Dollars tip. Free pizza night on Friday is a must.

I stayed here for two nights and i couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful, the rooms were clean and air conditioned, and the free breakfast was good for the price. The bag storage service was perfect for my situation, and the shower that came with it was a big plus. If I ever find my self back on the big island, I will absolutely be back.

I arrived here on Monday 3/5/18 around 11.15 PM. I think I was the last person checked in for the day.came from 5 hours flight from San Francisco.I got assigned room # 1 when I arrived in front of the door of my room # 1, there were like 20 people inside the room just talking and congregating. what a surprise welcome!they told me (the people congregating in the room) that the hostel got overbooked and we must share the bed as well just for the night. I thought to myself, what the hell ?anyway, they were joking and I was laughing.so, this hostel is a hostel that actually bring people together.where strangers become friends, a simple smile turned into a kiss.feeling welcomed, accepted and well looked after.suggestion: make the laundry area / common area brighter so that people utilize it and won't congregates in front of the rooms because some people likes to sleep early.U.C or (Youzee) : thank you for the hospitality, the kindness, and the quick response when our bathroom was clogged. you're amazing!Tim: thank you for being so patient with us, always kind, and always helpful.Rio: dude, thank you for being you! always smiling, happy and carefree!remember that night you were asking to see for my key because you didn't recognized me? haha, I hope you don't ask to see my key again next time because you're going to see me over and over again! lolChristine: thank you for the Island Vintage recommendation and the delicious waffles that you made, come to San Francisco I'll take you out to lunch and surfing :)Jasmine: you are kind, warm, and makes really mean waffles.I'm glad you found your cellphone!and last, ..Eugene: our Activity driver from Vladivostok.thank you, thank you, thank you!you are my friend now, I will come to see you soon again and again.yes, I recommend this hostel.Highly!

Staff are talkative and helpful, always ready with a recommendation on restaurants or places to visit. The dorm rooms are comfortable and the facilities are modern and clean. They have a rooftop area where you're sure to find new friends or drinking buddies and every Friday they have pizza night too which is a lot of fun. I didn't go on their tours, but they offer tours every day of the week to O'ahu's highlights which is convenient. It's just two blocks from the beach and right in the middle of the action. If you're travelling alone, it's the place to go to meet like-minded travellers. Best bang for your buck you can get!

one of my favourite hostels. such great staff, fantastic tours offered every day. such a social place,too. met great people which immediately felt like family for an unforgettable time in honolulu. great base for exploring oahu!

Even though this has already been more than two weeks, I want to share the amazing moments I had with all the new friends and wonderful people I met on my first solo traveling trip to Hawaii!From the minute I arrived at the hostel, I knew I was definitely going to have a blast! Everyone was so relaxed and welcoming. People quickly became friends from chatting and eating breakfast in the lobby, going on tours, going on hikes, and hanging out at the beach together.The staff members were also very welcoming and gave genuine advice on which airport shuttles to take, which public transportation services to use, where to visit based on personal preferences, and where to eat.This has got to be one of the most memorable trip in my life, such a wonderful place and such wonderful people. I cannot wait to go back next time!

The location is just so great, literally just three blogs away from Waikiki beach. The staff are all very nice and and everyone at the hostel was so nice and easy going. its def one of my best solo travel experiences. I would totally go back next time i go back to Oahu!

This Hostel made my trip to Hawaii unforgettable. Amazing location which is close to Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head and famous bars such as Hula's and easily reached by public bus system. The staff here were second to none as they always assisted me with any issues I had. LOVED LOVED LOVED the daily tours around different parts of Oahu; was able to cover so much ground through this option. Rooms were very clean with an ensuite bathroom included. My only issue was paying extra to towels where as other hostels, they have been provided free of charge, Definitely will stay again - top rate hostel.

I stayed in this hostel in the beginning of the year. I was in Oahu for two weeks and I can say it's by far the best two weeks of my life. This hostel is minutes walk from Waikiki Beach. The staff were so accommodating and so friendly. They offer all kinds of things, from beach gears to daily tours in the island to free breakfast and more. Pizza nights on Fridays! I met so many great people in here from different parts of the world. The rooftop hangs and the daily night events happening around the town (thanks to the calendar board the hostel provided!), I mean you will not feel left out at all! If you're a solo traveler, you like to meet people and make friends and make memories, I highly recommend this place. Kudos to you guys! I'll see ya again! xx

I'm not a big hostel type person, but I'm traveling alone & thought it would be a good way to meet some folks. I paid extra for a private room & a shared bath; it's (3) private bedrooms with a common area in the middle with a frig & microwave. Each unit has a window a/c unit & free wifi. Very basic room, no phone/tv and just a bed......I was lucky to have a little chair, but -0- furniture....which is fine for the price. Breakfast is basic, coffee, toast & homemade waffles (same menu each day). They have a shuttle that takes you to different tourists sites each day; mostly hiking & beach. It's basically a drop off/pick up service and it's only $10 except for the North Shore trip which is $20. Everyone who works here is very nice & helpful & they have a cool rooftop lounge & free pizza on Friday night! Plus, it's 2 blocks from the beach and the city bus stop is 5 minutes away (max). If you're looking for basic & cheap in Waikiki, this is your spot!

Highlights of this hostel: Free pizzas on Fridays.Free Daily road trips (just tip the driver $10 or $20 depending on the trip). Eugene the driver is a character :)Both allow you to meet people from around the world where you can learn about what’s a great activity to do / not do. Stayed in a semi private. Loved that it had fast wifi without any issue. Loved that there was a refrigerator within access unlike other hostels in Waikiki.And of course the free breakfast! They work so hard to keep it going for all the people that come through. I commend them for their great work, as well as the friendly room cleaning staff who I had a chat to as well. I know where to stay in my future visits in Oahu/waikiki. Proximity to the beach is so good! Can’t wait to be back. Book early to avoid disappointments like me (who had to change hostels halfway through my stay.)

everything is perfect absolutely nothing to say, there is everything you need here, kitchen, washer and dryer, clean bathroom! they even offer breakfast! the location is perfect, right next to the beach and finally the staff is too kind, they want our comfort, they offered us their best room the last two nights since we had stayed a week here .. it was much appreciated

This place is by American hostel standards a great place, very easy to meet new people, good rooms with a fridge inside. Breakfast was OK. The location is really good. They have a nice rooftop but its a shame they close it at 10 pm. Would stay again if I'm in Oahu.

We had a private room, with a shared bathroom and kitchen, and had a great stay! The location is absolutely perfect. Waikiki Beach is less than 2 blocks, and there’s anything you could want to eat (or shop for) within walking distance as well. The room was small, but all we needed. When in Hawaii, you’re doing it wrong if you’re spending all your time in the room! The free breakfast wasn’t a huge spread, but for the price, any breakfast is a bonus. We grabbed a couple of yummy muffins and some juice each morning before heading out. They have several parking spots that are $10(cash) per night. It was just my husband and I, and while we chose to do things on our own, we met some amazing people here. This place made it easy to keep to yourself, or join with others for socializing, as well. Obviously this hostel is not a luxury resort, but for the price and location, we could not have been happier!

Honestly, where do I even begin... I came to the Beach Waikiki Boutique early December not really knowing what to expect as it would be my first actual hostel experience and I was traveling solo. As soon as I had arrived to check in I was greeted with a warm and genuine welcome and was assisted with my luggage to my room. The hostel has a very modern "tiki-style" vibe and is most importantly CLEAN throughout! There are cleaners that go through the rooms everyday to ensure that both buildings are well-kept and up to standard for all guests. The hostel staff were also incredibly friendly and extremely knowledgeable on cheap local eats, nightlife, and attractions within the the area. I was surprised out how central the hostel was to everything, such as the Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium and Diamond Head Crater - not to mention the beach, which is literally a 2 minute walk away. Surfboards, snorkel gear, beach mats and towels, are all available for rent at the front desk (most are free), which is open 24/7. The hostel also provides guests with a delicious complimentary breakfast every morning as well as hosts a free pizza night on the rooftop patio every Friday night which I thought was a great way to bring everyone together. Every day spent here presented me with the opportunity to meet so many different and interesting people - whether they were guests, or staff working at the hostel. Although I was traveling solo I never really felt alone which was settling. I also noticed there were a huge amount of people trying to extend their stay; time flies when you're having fun, so book as far in advance as possible! The Beach Waikiki Boutique has exceeded my expectations by far and has set the bar incredibly high for my first hostel experience. I will definitely be staying here for my next visit to Waikiki.Thank you for everything.

The Beach Boutique hostel in Waikiki was such an integral part to the amazing trip my best friend and I had in Oahu! We stayed for a week and had no problems with the hostel. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the area. Special shout out to Yushi for giving us great recommendations and always making sure we had everything we needed! The hostel provides free breakfast. Nothing fancy but they will make fresh waffles everyday, provide toast, muffins, a variety of spreads, juices and coffee.One of the best parts of the hostel are the super cheap "tours" they provide. A tour is provided everyday to various spots around the island for $10. They have postings on the wall for where they go on each day. Sign up for these trips ASAP when you arrive because the lists get long. They typically drop you off at popular hike locations close to a beautiful beach. All of the tours we took (Monday-Wednesday) were worth the trip. They were also stress free since you just had to get to the pick up spot on time. Otherwise you were free to do whatever you wanted. Most days you would get back around 3-4. The only long day was the north shore. That is also the only tour that is $20. It's completely worth it since getting to the north shore otherwise is long (2-3 hours by bus), or some insane taxi or uber drive. The hostel gives you a lot of mobility if you don't have a car.I also loved that the hostel had a great quiet hour policy. The rooftop lounge was popping until 10pm and then the hostel quieted down while party-ers went out and people who were tired could get some shut eye.All the rooms had AC which was great. While only furnished with the basics (typical hostel style), everything was clean and well maintained. After a long winded review, I would definitely stay at the beach Waikiki hostel again!!

This hostel was amazing! The rooms where clean, everyday breakfest for free and friday a lot of pizza (of course for free too!)! They also organize everyday really cool trips to different adventures with their big bus. So you def have to join them one time! It is worthy! From the hostel it is like a 5 minutes walk to the beach and a perfect location for sunrise/sunset views and to do any kind of sports. You also will find lot of nice stores around. Thank you so much to the Team! Much love from Germany!!

Very friendly staff, they help you with everything during your stay. The location is great and I saw many people going to other places and coming back the day after to continue staying. Walking distance to the beach and touristic areas.

I loved this place so much!I was having a bit of a rough time solo travelling the world and this place made me feel so welcome, always asking how I was every morning! They even let me last minute change my booking as I decided to go home for a break last minute!Super nice place and the staff are the best, super caring and love what they do. Stay here if you're on Hawaii :)

Great staff super friendly always willing to help out with any questions and ideas !Good location super close to everything and do daily tours around waikiki mainly hiking which is great ! Thanks for the Great 5 nights legends!

Incredible experience! This hostel surpassed my high expectations (after reading all the positive reviews). Rooms are tidy (cleaners cleaning regularly), location is ideal (2 minute walk to the beach) and the people both staff and people staying here are awesome. This hostel is ridiculously cheap for the value, I would happily pay double what I paid ($35/night in 6 bunk room). It's crazy how this place brought so many people from all over the world together. There are plenty of communal areas like the dinning room for breakfast and the roof top for drinks. Another great thing about this hostel is the tours that super cheap and the fact that you get to do them with your newly made friends is a bonus. I was lucky because I booked my whole 12 night stay with them online, others were not so lucky, they loved it so much that they tried to extend multiple times, sometimes it worked out but other times it was just too popular. The staff are amazing, Yusik is one of the nicest people I've ever met and Eugene is an awesome tour guide. These people could do amazing in other jobs and industries because of their people skills yet they choose to work at this awesome place and make everyone feel like family. I can 100% say that I have made friends for life and a few of us will be meeting up next year in Australia. My expectations for hostels in the future have now risen significantly after staying here. Mahalo guys!

Definitely the best hostel I have stayed at! Its in such a good location, great atmosphere, the most friendly staff. There where heaps of organised events are well s free pizza night. Will be back for sure

This place was great, stayed on the rooftop in the private room and my experience was great, only reason is doesn’t get a five star rating is because I need to visit again and repeat the experience. Special thanks to Andy and all his crew for being always willing to help with anything during my visit. See you guys again and hopefully soon!

This hostel has a variety of rooms one block away from Waikiki Beach. The staff is super friendly and went above and beyond to help us out and make our stay enjoyable. The rooftop area is awesome for meeting people and enjoying the Hawaiian sun. I like the set up of the shared accommodations. It was basically a 3 bedroom apartment with shared common area and bathroom. Would definitely recommend this place.

This hostel is brand new and clean. The dorm is only 4 people with a bathroom which is very convenient. I was in the main building. The staff has been very helpful and kept me in the same dorm when I extented 2 times. The waffle at breakfast is perfect! love the fancy sheets. The rooftop is great. Just the kitchen is too small and the coffee is not good. And I could receive a package there even though It did not came on time. Be careful if you have something to be sent, a package from Maui took more than one week to come, this is only the USPS fault here!The daily excursion are very convenient when you do not have a car! I had a fun time there!

This hostel provides all kinds of fun stuff to do. You get daily activities( which are actually worth it, coming from someone who hates going on touristy tours). The atmosphere is great, easy to meet travelers. Location is key, walking distance to Waikiki beach, pubs,cafes etc…and a wonderful rooftop terrace to hangout and cook your own meals. They also provide a good breakfast.Only downside, the rooms would need a little retouch and painting (A little run downed )but would still recommend it regarding the time spent in the room.

We booked this hostel for 3 nights but when we arrived here and spent one night we decided to stay one week more. We had private room with shared bathroom, there was a kind of kitchen with fridge. Staff is great, waffles with maple syrup for breakfast are so delicious. The location is perfect.

This hostel is one of my favorites I've ever stayed at -- the atmosphere, location, and staff all make it great! The rooms are clean with AC. The staff are super helpful and friendly -- there is someone at the front desk 24/7 which is also really nice. The location of the hostel is perfect: it's a block away from the beach and right in downtown Waikiki. The roof common area is always fun and it seems like everyone who stays here is down to adventure. Highly recommend!

I had a fabulous few nights here when I first arrived in Waikiki. The hostel is located extremely closely to the beach which is fantastic. As a slightly more 'mature' lady traveller (41) I took a semi-shared private room rather than a dormitory and absolutely loved it. I met lots of really interesting people, some who were guests and some who were more permanent residents at the hostel. My bedroom was a fairly spacious room with hangers to hang clothes, air con, central fan and a lockable bedside cabinet plus a huge private balcony. It was very comfortable (great mattress) and gave me privacy but was also good for socialising with other guests. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Waikiki! All the members of staff were so helpful and accommodating and really went out their way to try and help you as much as they could. I have to give a special mention to Ushi, who is worth 5 stars plus! I would highly recommend this hostel!

This is really a great place for young travellers. I have been here twice for a one-night stay. It is very affordable as far as Hawaii goes and the people who stay and work there are friendly and easy-going. It is not luxurious by any means, but it is clean and has good atmosphere.

I had a fabulous time staying at the hostel! I was working at one of the hospitals for a month and didn't know anyone in the area, so a hostel was ideal for me to meet people and go exploring on my days off. It was one of the cleanest hostels I've stayed in with cleaning service daily. The staff were extremely nice and very on top of things. If I ever needed anything, Rio took care of it right away. There was a day where they were updating the room next door and some water leaked from the bottom of the wall to the outside of my suitcase. Within minutes of letting Rio know, he had alerted maintenance, set up fans to dry, and covered any laundering of my clothing in case I needed it. Great service! I met some of the nicest people and made several dear friends from all over the country and the world during my time there. Most people think they'll only stay a few days and end up extending their stay an extra week because they like it so much - so you need to book a room early because it always fills up! The owner, Andy, buys everyone free pizza for pizza parties on the rooftop patio every Friday which is a great way to meet everyone from the hostel! Great guy! The location is unbeatable - 2 blocks from the beach for unlimited sunshine and sunsets :) I'll definitely be back!

I have been staying here for a week and had one of the best time during my visit. the staff was absolutely amazing. Especially Rio who has made the visit even better. Not only an employee but lifelong friend.

I stayed here for about a week. It was fantastic. Friendly staff, roof top that you can have some drinks and meet new people. Stayed in a 4 bed female dorm sharing 1 bathroom which worked out fine. That only down fall is the internet didn't always work but the rest was great. Highly recommend!

The staff is pretty nice ! Shoyen White is a nice element to the team. Great roof top where you can eat and make friends. The breakfast is included , there is also a nice parrot. 5 mins walk from the beach.

I highly recommend this hostel for every kind of traveller. Of all the hostels that I stayed at during my Hawaii trip this one was definitely one of my favorites. There is simple breakfast every morning, inexpensive exploring Oahu tours, air conditioned rooms and great socializing areas. I really appreciated the awesome staff of the hostel. Everybody is helpful and has great tips for food and exploring. Shout out goes to Shoyen, Tim, Rio and Jay. You guys were fantastic and I can't wait to visit you again. If I am ever coming back to the wonderful islands of Hawaii, I am glad to have a great place to stay that feels like home.

It was the best location. Walking distance from anything and everything you need! Right when you step out the front door you see Diamond Head which made for a beautiful view.The rooftop food area and patio was wonderful to meet people or to decompress away from the busy Waikiki centre. My only issue was the wifi never worked in the room.Other than that, great experience.

I stayed here with 5 other friends during our spring break trip.The hostel staff were all very accommodating; they advised us on great places to visit and restaurants to check out (shout-out to Shoyen!). We did a full day hike and tour organized by the hostel for $20 / each which we really enjoyed. The hostel also provided towels ($1 each to rent) and lifesavers which made for lots of fun at the beach-- not to mention, the beach was a 5 min walk from the hostel! They had a kitchen, washing machines, sinks, clotheslines, nice rooftop area, and an amiable parrot!All in all, the hostel served all of our needs given our budget. Some things to know:+ as with most hostels, one bathroom is shared by 8 people+ the mini-kitchen is communal; "free breakfast" = toast and small muffins so don't rely on that for your day's energy+ towels are $1 to rent each

My friend and I stayed in a semi-private room here for four nights. It came with a nice kitchenette and modern bathroom, cable TV and air con. The room was also spacious, clean and comfortable The rooftop was a great place to relax after a big day of activities and the crew here host things on the rooftop (like a free pizza night!) so you can meet people. The rooftop shuts at 10pm so the team can make sure everyone who needs it can get a good night's sleep, so when we needed an early night noise wasn't an issue. Everyone here was so warm and friendly, but special shout out to Rio who went the extra mile to make us feel right at home! He was great to have around for a chat and to help with anything we needed, and he gave us tips to explore Honolulu like locals. We had so much fun at The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel and can recommend them to everyone.

It's a well located hostel, within 5 min to the beach, and bus 19/20 pass only 5 min from the hostel. It offers free breakfast, Wifi and luggage storage. The rooms are divided by single, double or shared apartments. (with private rooms and bunk beds).

I have never stayed at a hostel prior to here and was leery since I was traveling with my 10 yr old. No worries! This place has the best hospitality!! They treat you like family and you can't beat the location!! Hands down one of the best vacations. Mahalo!

Stayed here few times and this hostel is nice clean..it has open rooftop and 3 mins walk to the beach / near by Hulas gay bar too. You can take the bus from airport to the hostel. I recommend it . Cheers

I first booked just two weeks at The Beach, but after one week I extended my stay for the hole six weeks on Oahu. It was just perfect for me as a solo traveller, I met so many great people on the roof top, which is a really great place, the staff was sooo nice and friendly and awesome and they give you some good advise (big mahalo to Shoyen, Tracy and everyone else!!!! And I miss the little monster Shandie, the parrot :D). The beach and the bus stop are just around the corner, you can rent things for the beach for free or just a few dollar and at some evenings the hostel offers free food for everyone (for example Pizza night, yummie). Oh and of course there is free breakfast every morning.One thing that would make the hostel even better would be another common room inside and some small renovations. But all in all I really enjoyed my stay and I will never forget this time and the People and this hostel!Mahalo :)Maren

Pro's: 2 minutes walk from waikiki beach, honolulu zoo and also for the keen you can walk up to diamond head crater (about 2.5-3hrs round trip).Cons: Accomodation itself is shithouse. Definately needs a good renovation and the air conditioning sounds like a constant fart. Also, besides the roof top (which is across the road from where I have actuallu been put up), there is little common area to relax.Its "stayable" I guess but I wouldn't return.

Great location, amazing people, great staff (Thanks Shoyen, Rio, Kay, River, and anyone I forgot!) I had so much fun there, and the rooftop is always fun. It's great for meeting people while traveling, and trips go out from there all the time that are organized by the hostel. They got free pizza every Friday night, and there are always people down to drink and party. A+ experience! Unforgettable!

I stayed 2 weeks in this hostel, and it was fabolous!The staff is super nice (special mention to Shoyen, Nash, Rio and Andy) !The rooftop is perfect for the breakfast and the pregame, rooms are clean, and the hostel offer some free tours everyday !If I come back to Honolulu one day, I'll definitely going back to this one !Mahalo <3

Shoyen was very helpful to me on my travels as I was wearing a boot on my leg and it was difficult for me so she organise for a low bunk bed and also helped organise for my luggage to be taken up the stairs. Very close to the beach . Close to the bus stop

Reasonably priced for Honolulu which is extremely expensive, we paid $35 each a night in a six man room. Rooftop lounge with cooking available. Free lounge chairs for the beach. Very friendly staff. As always great people at the hostel to meet.

I've traveled and backpacked around the world , and the Beach has to be one of the best hostels I've ever stayed at.This hostel ticked every box, the staff were great, the beds and rooms were great, and the people and vibe it gave were perfect.(Also they do free pizza nights... What else do you need really?)It's in the perfect location , just a block or two from Waikiki Beach, and the Beach also offers tours and activities if you wanna spend your days roaming Oahu.Mahalo !Nash

This hostel has a really great value! It's well locate, it's really clean, the rooms are nice, the staff is kind and very helpful, you have free pizza night and free breakfast every morning, they offer tours, etc. I'ts just perfect and I really enjoyed my stay!

I stayed at this hostel for my third time, back in Feburary of this year (2017.) Shoyen's hospitality was amazing, as usual, and both River and Tim were both friendly and helpful as well. Location is great, wifi is great, and so are the daily breakfast and twice weekly dinners. Definitely recommend this place! Many mahalos - ALOHA!

Had a blast staying here for 5 days. Shoyen, Andy and River are just awesome people. The rooftop is huge and you're guaranteed to make friends if you just say hi! Somehow this place draws in fantastic travellers it was almost sad to leave :'(Hit me up when you come to Australia guy and gals :)

I cannot say enough good things about this hostel! I was traveling alone and immediately met other solo travelers from all around the world while staying here. The free breakfast is great, especially if you're on a budget. And it's awesome that you can cook your own food right on the rooftop kitchen. This hostel is literally down the road from Waikiki Beach and the Waikiki strip. Perfect location if you don't want to rent a car. I had the time of my life exploring the island with the people I met at this hostel. The rooftop is a great hang out spot. My room was very clean and the bathroom was super nice. The employees also were there 24/7 if you ever needed anything. They were all so friendly! 5 stars! I'm definitely coming back to stay here whenever I'm on the island.

When we arrived, we didn't had any reservations but we got easily 2 bunks in a dorms, really low price for what you get. the staff was super nice, really friendly, always someone at the reception to help you ! The room was really clean and then we got to meet so many nice people over there too ! Thanks you so much our stay was really awesome !

After 7 month of travelling I slept in a lot of hostel beds and I have to say this hostel was by far the best one I've been to!It's not just about the facilities, I never had so kind and helpful staff! Every room has next to FAST free Wifi also its own bathroom and fridge plus a simple free breakfast in the morning and even two times free pizza at night time. Free use of volleyball, beachpong etc and just a small renting fee for snorkel gear and surfboards. Super close to the beach, free cookies and even a parrot as a hostel pet.When my friends and I (in total 3) arrived every dorm was booked. Instead of just sending us away they tried to help us as good as possible and so we all had a place to sleep in the end of the day. Thanks again for that you saved us! Doesn't matter if you need advise for your next day trip or just want to know where to eat the best poke they always had an advise for us - all in all the pleasant atmosphere in this hostel creates the perfect hawaiian holiday feeling.Mahalo for everything!

This was an awesome hostel. Our room had its own bathroom and fridge. The hostel was in a really good location, we felt very safe walking around at night and it was very close to the beach and ABC convenience stores. While we were there the hostel had a free pizza night on the roof which was a great way of meeting people. The hostel let us use the showers and bathrooms on the roof after we had already checked out.

Stayed here in a 6 person mixed dorm for 3 nights. Staff were super friendly, the wifi was strong (I was even streaming Netflix) and it is a 2 minute walk from Waikiki beach. The atmosphere was really good, with free Pizza Hut pizza on a Tuesday night! I made new friends who I went hiking with.There's a chill rooftop balcony where you get free breakfast every morning. Had super fresh bread / toast and coffee. There's washer/dryer facilities and the mattresses/ pillows seem new and fresh. The water pressure and temperature in the shower was excellent.I would definitely stay here again!

This isn't too bad of a hostel for a night or two. Its 24-hour reception is really useful for people who have early flights, but the rooms themselves are pretty average. The floors felt grimy and whilst the bathroom was new - it wasn't particularly clean either. We stayed in a four person dorm, which included a kitchen and full-size fridge. However, they don't actually allow you to use any of the kitchen amenities.The whole hostel also has quite a strong cigarette scent and is quite noisy. On a more positive note - the wifi works really well in rooms and the hostel isn't too far away from the nightlife

I stayed 4 weeks, in a 6 room dorm. There is a key that everyone gets, I found that there was lots of respect, with being quiet, there is a bathroom and fridge and a locker for your personals to keep safe. Bring your own lock. They clean room every morning, Shoyen White is a wonderful person, if you need anything.ask her she is always there to help you if you need anything. Watch out for the crazy bird. Lol

The hostel isn't bad its self, the roof top is the nicest part.Bad experience during our stay, they had work going on in one of the rooms and started very early with drills and banging...going on through all afternoon!!!! We stayed in a bunk bed (room 12) had cockroaches all in the sides and cracks of the beds. Not what you want to see as your about to go to bed at 11pm, after killing at least 10 of them ourselves...they refused to let us change rooms or even come and have a look at the situation...Just said it's common that we get these!! He gave us two boxes that catches them throughout the night and expected us to sleep in those beds. We ended up sleeping in one bed on the top bunk of a spare one in our dorm, looked at the boxes in the morning and found more than 10 roaches in each box...disgusting!!!!

I've stayed at his hostel 7 times in the last 4 years and I would not stay anywhere else when I'm in Honolulu/Waikiki. The staff there is amazing... from all the friendly people that run the front desk, to the maintenance and cleaning crew that work so hard to keep breakfast area stocked and the place nice and clean, including Shandie, the talking parrot that greets you :-) ... they all create a wonderful atmosphere that makes me feel like home whenever I'm in town. The hostel is very convenient to everything that Waikiki has to offer and the staff goes the extra mile in helping everyone that wants to explore the island. I would not stay anywhere else in Waikiki :-)

Absolutely loved my stay here. Dec31-Jan17th If you like clean updated and an amazing staff , a safe place, quiet and respectful than this is your place! I stayed 16 nights and I really enjoyed my time spent here. I really felt at home. Staff is super lovely! I enjoyed the free pizza nights and the Panda Express along with the continental breakfasts . Grocery market is a quick 10-15 min walk away. I definitely felt well taken care of here and safe. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone! Thank you for everything!!!!!

I loved it here so much the first time i'm back two years later! Perfect location. Such a lovely little hostel, It's a very clean hostel with a nice roof top to drink and socialise with those in the hostel or even just relax in one of the hammocks. Free breakfast everyday...which I never made as I slept in to much. Also Tuesday is free pizza night...so much pizza and Saturday is free BBQ. Great enthusiastic staff to greet you and help you plan a great stay in Honolulu. Would be five stars however small things like our bathroom door didn't shut properly and the light switch broke and the man came to fix it and made it worse as it turned off before he tampered with it. He said he would be back to do it...and never came back so was stuck with the light on all night which was pretty annoying!!

This is the best hostel in Waikiki, without question. The rooftop provides an opportunity to engage and interact with other guests. If you are traveling alone there is always fellow guests looking to hike, surf, etc. Free pizza and BBQ is a definite bonus, within 3 minutes of beach.

I have stayed here twice - for four days in January 2016 and then again, for two weeks, in November of 2016. The fact that I returned, has to say something! The location is amazing, the rooms are spacious and well-maintained, and the daily breakfast and twice weekly dinners (pizza night and BBQ night) are a nice touch! A special thanks to Shoyen for making my stay extra special. Mahalo nui loa! I look forward to my next visit!

As the first hostel I stayed at on my 6 month North American adventure, I could not have felt more welcomed. I made a number of impressive and unforgettable friends, loved the day tour I did with Josh (Good vibes tours) and also who can forget Yhen and Shandie, (the gorgeous and entertaining arara parrot) at front desk. One thing that could be improved was the cleaning some days, but as I mentioned, it was really only some of the days the person didn't do the job properly. Also brekky is included, and boards are available for free/rent so you can go enjoy some of those long run waves at Waikiki :)I had previously stayed at Ashton Waikiki up on the beachfront, but would rate this hostel over that place ANYDAY.

The Beach is a handy hostel less than 5 minutes walk from Waikki beach and about 7 minutes walk to the zoo. It's all about location with this place. It's basic, there is no denying. I stayed in a four dorm room, a bit of a squeeze but we managed. The sheets provided were clean but the bathroom was a bit grim and there was mouldy food left by previous roommates. Best not look down the side of your bunk beds as it ain't always pretty. The aircon worked, there was basic free breakfast and some free food some nights. Boogie boards were free, surfboards could be hired, even beach towels for 1 dollar a week. If you are young and on a budget but if you have previously spent time in resorts or hotels, it may be a challenge to go back to roughing it. Despite some cleanliness issues ( it could have been just my room), it's a smashing spot in a very very expensive Waikki.

I stayed here for 5 nights in a room with two other women. I lucked out they were amazing and so much fun to hang out with! The hostel offered free breakfast which consisted of toast/ peanut butter and jelly/ oatmeal/ coffee/ mini muffins. Pretty good for what you pay for! We also got treated to a free BBQ dinner on Saturday night. Be on time. The food goes fast! Cons: Our room smelled like that spray you use to cover up smoke. I had to wash/ febreez everything when I got home to get rid of the smell. $20 cash refundable room key deposit. $1 for a towel. No lockers in our room like promised. I would definitely come back. Great location. 2 blocks from beach. Cheapest place you will find in Waikiki.

This hostel is in a great location at the end of Waikiki close to Diamond Head. The staff were very friendly and provided breakfast for free every morning and on Tuesday night offered free pizza. The beds were pretty comfortable and the bathrooms were really nice.

Location, location, location. It was good, hostel was clean (I don't count the ants, because they're everywhere), rooftop cozy, coming and going to hostel easy, it is close to transportation, walking distance from beach, waikiki shopping area (in case interested) etc. Next street has affordable scooter rental. It is also quite a big hostel which means there is not that close connection with all the people that in a bit smaller hostels.

Great location in the heart of Honolulu. Less than a five minute walk to Waikiki beach.Close to bus stops and ABC stores to buy anything you need.I stayed in a semi private room which was pretty bare-bones. There was another semi-private room adjacent to mine. This connected to the main room which had a bunk bed, twin bed, lockers, kitchenette and a bathroom which we all shared. Bathroom wasn't too bad since it was cleaned every day. I felt very safe there as a solo female traveler. The gate locked, the main door locked and I had a lock on my door.Only complaint would be some staff are pretty rude.

Not a single bad thing to say about this Hostel, ABSOLUTELY PERFECT location so that gives it 5 stars alone and then on top of that extremely nice workers. Lots of things to rent if you want to pay for that but they do give free boogie boards (not the best quality but that's understandable if it's free) and the rooms are also nice as well, plenty of outlets and lockers in each room. They do pizza night and another kind of night throughout the week, I'm not sure what it was because I wasn't there but it's free and a very good way to chat with other travelers who are ready to mingle!

I spent four nights in a six bed dorm and had a great time. The room was an average size with three bunk beds, a kitchenette, air conditioning and a bathroom. I had to make my bed myself which I don't like doing, especially when on top bunk. The beds were pretty comfortable. The wifi was also good.The bathroom was really disappointing as it was not properly cleaned and the bin was not emptied daily. The shower curtain smelled awful.There is a rooftop area where people hang out with a few drinks but this closes at 10pm so most people would make their way to some of the bars.The location is perfect. It's a two minute walk from Waikiki beach and lots of bars, restaurants, cafes and shops. The staff were friendly and very laid back. You can arrange airport transfers through the hostel.There is a washing machine and dryer but it can only be used at certain times which I found inconvenient.I would recommend the hostel, it's sociable and comfortable. I just think better care needs to be taken when cleaning, especially the bathrooms.

The word AWESOME is not quite enough to describe how it was to stay at this hostel. This is the place you Have to book when going to Honolulu or Oahu general! Location CAN'T be better, a street away from Waikiki Beach and from tons of convenient stores, restaurants, etc. The staff is Awesome! Elis, Shoyen, Tim, Andy and Shandie the macaw are all Friendly & Helpful! They go out of their way to make sure you are having a blast. Also they would give you great recommendations based on your own needs.I would also recommend to book a tour w/ Josh the Good Vibe Tours guy, So worth it you Won't regret it!I stayed in a shared room clean & Very comfy w/kitchen and locker. Time spent at the rooftop either for breakfast or at night, the amazing people from all over the world that you get to meet + all above made my stay Priceless.And not to mention that Hawaii is a freaking PARADISE! Thank you All who made my stay Unforgetable! Also met other people that stayed at the hostels near by before this one, and they said Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel beat them all because of all the amenitiens, environment, etc I didn't try the other ones, luckily I came straight to the right one!On Saturdays they have BBQ night (comp/included), super yummy and Fun!Aloha, you are going to LOVE this place :)

Great location. Great staff. Dedicated bathrooms. A/c & rooftop patio. Cheap rentals and close to buses. Would definitely stay here again! Biggest asset is how close to everything it is. 1 block from beach!

This hostel was fantastic! The staff were super helpful and friendly, especially Tim and Yhen (and Shandie the parrot!) these guys all went out of their way to make sure we were having fun and recommended great activities. I wouldn't stay in another hostel, this was perfect, air con and lockable lockers in every room. Really fantastic location and the rooftop area is great, make sure you spend some time there on the first night and you'll meet some great people! Thanks Tim and Yhen!!!!!

I have visited Honolulu 3 years in a row. During each visit, I stayed at the Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel. I was very fortunate to have found this hostel. Travelling Solo, it was a great place to meet new people and make new friends. The rooms were clean and thankfully air conditioned. The rooftop patio was a very nice touch and offered a great start to every evening. The staff every year have always done an outstanding job and I have come to consider some of them friends. The manager, Shoyen White, did an excellent job at making me comfortable and was always very accommodating. The other staff members were sure to keep things fun and always made sure the guests were enjoying themselves. Kat, Tim and Fernando did an awesome job. Amazing vacation. Amazing Hostel. I'll be back next year.

I enjoyed the staff here, the beach is right around the corner and ABC stores near each end of the street. I stayed in a 4 bed dorm, it was pretty clean and spacious. The rooftop is the spot to meet people and is also super relaxing. Met other amazing solo travelers and shared stories with some of the staff. Overall a great stay (:

I stayed at the Beach hostel for around 10 days in September. I loved spending the evenings on the rooftop mixing with the other guests. I found the rooms to be very well kept and the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly! Especially Yhen and her bird friend. Would definitely recommend this place.

I stayed at The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel for three weeks in June 2016 in a 4 women dorm. It was an absolutely amazing experience! Really nice hostel with a great location. A few minutes from the beach, and anywhere in Waikiki is walkable from here! Great bars and restaurants is all around, and the hostel arranges two dine-in nights a week, which was really fun! Really nice room, which was cleaned every day. Whenever we dragged to much sand home and asked for a broom, they would come clean it immediately - and the staff in general was so nice and welcoming! Shoyen from the reception always made sure we had whatever we needed! I was placed in a dorm with other long-term travellers, so we had so much fun together. It was so easy meeting people there, and I had a lot of fun with the other guests. I would recommend this hostel to anyone visiting Oahu whether for a few days or long-term! The bus is really close by and takes you anywhere on the island, so from here you can experience all of Oahu on a budget!

Awesome location, right by the beach and just off the Main Street in Waikiki, super friendly staff.Very accommodating. Bunch of free gear rentals, free dinners on Sundays and Tuesday; free breakfast.Very easy to meet people, rooms were really clean! Parking outside the door at low cost or free parking just a 3-4 min walk. Would definitely recommend staying there :) made our time in Hawaii soooo much fun!

The Beach Boutique Hostel has everything you would expect from your standard hostel. The staff are friendly, supportive and you can rent all the beach gear you would ever need for a day in the sun. The hostel itself is located about a minutes walk away from the sea front in the very touristy area of Waikki. Lots of bars and shop to visit.Lastly free pizza on a Tuesday night is nice touch!I will be recommending this hostel to other people.

The Beach Boutique is less than five minutes from the beach and is generally in a good location for getting about O'ahu. The hostel dorms are a little basic but do have very good a/c which is important in Hawaii. Each dorm also has its own fridge! There is a free light breakfast and there is also a free bbq which was huge and very good. The price of this hostel is probably about right for what you get. Each dorm has a terrace and the hostel has a good welcoming atmosphere. The staff here were also friendly. I made some good friends here and would come back if I was staying in Waikiki again.

I was very skeptical about staying in a hostel, but I honestly loved my stay there. I was there for 11 days. Free pizza nights on Tuesdays and free BBQs on Saturdays. The staff is wonderful and the pet bird Shandy was adorable..if you're looking for affordable accommodations and super close to the beach, I highly recommended staying there. Thank you to the awesome staff! MAHALO I would definitely stay there again!
user_name:
Laura C
Victoria, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: This hostel was clean and the rooftop set up was perfect for any time of day. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I felt like I was home during my stay and cannot wait to go back. Kat, Shoyen, Alex, and Fernando were incredible.The location was just a 3 minute walk to the beach and everything you need is walking distance or just hop on a bus around the corner.

I spend two weeks on the Waikiki Boutique Hostel in a 4-person girl dorm. The room was nice and clean and we loved having our own fridge! The common area on the roof was fine but the hostel didn't plan a lot of activities which is important if you're a backpacker like myself. -The kitchen area was not that good and not very clean but it worked. The breakfast was boring however the barbecue night and pizza night was awesome! Plenty of food for free. -The staff was very nice and extrovert especially Shoyen behind the counter was a lot of fun! She is exactly what a hostel needs. Overall I had a great time on Oahu with a nice place to stay every night (Waikiki Beach Hostel)

I stayed at the Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel for 5 nights in August in a private room. The hostel is well placed two blocks back from the beach. The rooms were basic but clean and spacious with good air conditioning. We stayed in room 17 which is on the top floor - it was good having the extra space after 10pm but bad if you don't want people waking you up when breakfast is served.Overall I thought the hostel provided good value for money and would stay here again.

Stayed here for a week in August 2016 in a semi private room.My partner and myself had our own room with shared kitchen and bathroom.There wasn't much in terms of kitchen utensils but the bathroom was kept clean.Parking is $10 per night which is cheaper than other hotels that offer parking.Location is very close to the beach and easily within walking distance to everything. Didn't find the place noisy at all. The place was perfect for us as we didn't spend much time in room and I liked that we weren't too close to main Waikiki.Our friends stayed in a dorm upstairs to us but their room wasn't clean or made up when they were checked in. Problem was quickly and easily solved.
