Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Wow what a great find this hostel was!! Like many others I was nervous travelling solo but that didn't last very long once I got to the hostel.. Met the best bunch of people which helped make my stay in Hawaii even more amazing!! Can not fault the hostel with great staff; Shoyen, Tim, Kathryn, Fernando & Alex, great rooms & awesome rooftop dining! Mahalo!! Kati, Australia xx

Emma, 31, AustraliaI always travel solo and love it; however there are certainly times where I feel a little anxious and overwhelmed at the thought of feeling comfortable and making new friends... This almost immediately faded as a checked in.The rooms were spacious and cleanThe aircon was great.. Almost too cold sometimes lolThe rooftop deck is great for chilling in a hammock or having a few drinks or a few too many and even watching a movie.Everyone was really helpful at recommending great places to eat activities and hikes.Breakfast was included which helped save a few bucks.Pizza night and Bbq night were also amazing, who doesn't love a free feed with great company?It has to be one of the best locations in Waikiki, close to great food bars and only 1 block from the beach, what more could you want?They say everything happens for a reason, right? And I'm glad the Boutique Hostel happened to me!You'd be absolutely crazy if you booked anywhere else.The staff quickly became friends and ones that I hope to see again soon! Guys you rock!! Thanks Kat, Fernando, Shoyen, Alex, Tim and I can't forget Shandie (resident macaw) Love you guys! And you too Peter hahahaMahalo and see you soon, real soon xx

I have stayed this hostel It is very fresh and cleanBreakfast is perpect that have bread, okeumil, jam, orange juice and etc.Employ is also cool and pretty.I like fernando that is one of handsome employ

The workers were friendly and great! There was a slight mix up with my reservation (my fault) and they worked with me to get everything figured out. Great location and the roof top common area was awesome! Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

First time in a hostel, the place was clean, the free breakfast and condition air was very nice. The rooftop is awesome. The staff were very cool, espicially Shyoen and Tim. I have already suggest this place for many people, it's the best hostel in Waikiki.

I have travelled all over the world for many years. Seldom have I felt so instantly welcome at a hotel. This place is special. When I left for other islands, I missed the staff and my friends here and came back to spend time with them.Perfect location, friendly people, well managed, clean and comfortable.A friend who manages a hostel in Australia heard I would be travelling to Hawaii, and the first thing he told me was that I had to check this place out. He was right, I'm back again and don't want to leave!

We stayed for 10 nights here in a 4 bed dorm after reading reviews that this was the best hostel in Waikiki. The hostel is situated very close to the beach which was perfect for us. Lots of convenience stores nearby. And short walk to larger supermarkets. Very close to popular bars and takeaway food places, shops etcCheap surfing and snorkelling equipment was a bonus. The staff were all friendly and chatty but often distracted and unhelpful.The free breakfast was not great compared to other hostels. Just bread and a few mini muffins. It's all outside on the roof and birds and lizards get VERY close. However the free pizza nights and BBQ nights were excellent.Our room was basic. The cleaners did come in every day but hygiene was average overall. The air con was a bonus! Not many hostels offer this!If you are planning on cooking at the hostel please be aware there is only a microwave and one hob!It rained a lot when we were there so it was a shame we didn't get to use the communal area much as its all outside!!Overall our stay was good. Perfect for travellers!

Loved this hostel I had a fab time, the rooms in the separate building to the main hostel are just like staying in an apartment. I had a double bed and a big room with a shared bathroom between 4, great! I was there for Christmas and they put on a big dinner and then we all went out in the evening, great communal area and friendly staff. You can rent surf boards from there very cheap and the beach is a 3 minute walk away, there is also a moped/bike rental place the next road a long. Easy to get to shops, restaurants and bars and I would stay here again.

I had reserved this facility early (like 2 months before Memorial Day weekend), but they sold the rooms off to somebody else for all but one night, because I had not called in to confirm. That shows you how busy and in-demand this place is, during holiday weekends and travel seasons. They do have free breakfasts (very basic continental items), and good well-maintained clean rooms to stay in. This facility is 3 minutes walk from Waikiki beach, 1 minute from the ABC store, and easily accessible to the bus stops and other local attractions such as the Honolulu Zoo. I strongly recommend the place to anybody looking to spend a few nights on the island, on a budget.

This would be my second time to stay in a hostel and I didn't have any complaints. I stayed there from June 3-10( I wish I stayed longer) I arrived late which was at 10pm and I met one of staff named Tim. He's very attentive, full of information, approachable and of course, very helpful. I got to the room and yea pretty small but that's what the price is for. Nevertheless, It was a great stay. I loved the free barbecue and pizza night at the rooftop every Saturday and Tuesday night and of course the free breakfast every day that they offer(Loved the macadamia coffee). I met a lot of new people who I made friends with. It started as soon as I step in the hostel. The hostel itself is pretty clean but I've seen few cockroach though it didn't bother me. Bed is pretty standard and AC is working great. Also, they got plenty of free-to-use items such as beach mats, chairs, body boards and some amenities for your skin care, also lots of books to be used for free. We always hangout at the rooftop or patio but it's being closed at 10pm due to neighbors' complaints for being loud every night, so management decided to shut it down at 10. Too sad. Overall, I love this hostel, iIt feels home every time Im there. The staff; Fernando, Tim, Shoyen and other korean employee are really great at what they do. Very informative, always with a smile every time they welcome me or us in. Mahalo!!

I was super stoked with my stay at this hostel - the staff were amazing with helping me out with tips and any requests or help needed and always had a smile on their face and positive vibes! I was upgraded to the private housing across the road and this little place felt like home! Everything was clean and the rooftop hangout was also a great communal spot. Location here is prime a great central spot for walking around Waikiki!

Excellent location - close to beach and bus routes. Very comfortable beds. I really liked having our own big fridge (and freezer!!) in our 4-bed female room. Very clean and the rooftop was fun to hang out on. The free pizza and bbq was awesome. Would definitely stay again.

Excellent location, only two blocks from Waikiki beach, close to Diamond Head entrance, There is a free pizza at the rooftop once in the week, I was sharing a room with other 5 guys and the room was always clean, important to say that is available one big fridge at each room

After a very delayed flight, didn't get in till early morning. The guy in reception was waiting for us, as we had sent our flight details. Amazing!! The room was spacious and very nice for a dorm style. The location of this hotel is everything with a convenient store, scooter hire, the zoo, the beach in very close walking distance. Very chill open area on the roof but didn't stay at the hotel for long at all, were out exploring

I stayed here for 2 nights before catching my flight back to Australia in a semi-private room and it was nice. The semi-private room was actually in a separate building across the road from the hostel. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was another room and a set of bunks in the main room so you could potentially be sharing with up to 4 other people. They also had free pizza on the rooftop area one night we were there, which is a super cool area where everyone hangs out and had a way more communal vibe than the hostel I stayed in Waikiki the week prior. I can't say much for the dorm rooms but I do remember the prices being a little higher than others around. If you're looking for something super budget this probably isn't the hostel for you, but it's super social so this hostel would be great for solo travellers.

I really enjoyed my time in this hostel. It is close to the Waikiki Beach, the zoo and a bus stop . The room was clean and had a fridge outside. You can rent a lot of beach stuff , some for free . The roof top is a good place to hang out with other people from the hostel ,although they close it at 10pm, as well as enjoying free Pizza and BBQ once a week . The staff were really helpfulI and friendly. I had a really good time and would recommend staying there

This hostel was located in the heart of Waikiki. A short walk to the beach and shopping centers. Bus system runs right in front of it so easy access to the rest of the island. Beds were ok but made ALOT of noise if you slightly moved and AC in room did not work at all so it was very warm. Had a fridge in the room and kitchen area upstairs which was great. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would stay at again if we return on a tight budget

This place is in a sweet spot near the beach and zoo in Waikiki and isn't too big. The rooms all have a fridge and bathroom and are decent size, relatively clean and cool. Upstairs roof is nice and they give you breakfast every day and dinner twice a week which is not just a sandwich and water but a huge spread. One night was bbq and another was pizza. The staff are friendly and helpful and theres a bunch of free gear that you can take to the beach. You can shower and hang out if you have a late flight too (as I did). They have really paid attention to the little things travellers need/desire and the small things make a big difference. And for a very reasonable price.

Fee WIFI but slow in some areas. Friendly and Helpful staff and easy to meet and make friends via there hosting of events and free dinner and food. There's lots of hotels that don't have free Wifi....

Great location close to everything in Waikiki. I stayed in a 4 bed female dorm and was lucky to get a nice room of girls who weren't party animals. Not a lot of organised activities like other hostels I've stayed in but there's so much to do nearby that you didn't really notice that.

I recommend it to everyone! Great staff, great service, free wifi, near beach, great price. I liked everything about this hostel. It is good organized, expecialy that balkony.Just bring your sheets, I didnt liked mine, and bathrooms are really small. Everything else great for that money!

Had an amazing week here at this hostel. I travelled solo and made new friends super easily . Bedrooms were nice and the hostel was so centrally located it was great. The staff go above and beyond to ensure you have a great stay especially Shoyen! Hope to come back again :)

I stayed in a 4 bed female dorm it contained shower and toilet, huge fridge, freezer and microwave. On Tuesday and Saturday you can sign up for free dinner. The pizza and chicken are really yummy. Shoyen the lady at reception was extremely helpful, and all of the other staff. Helped carry my luggage as I was travelling injured. I stayed 12 nights. I meet some lovely people. Breakfast is included blue berry muffins, whole meal toast and oats if you like, rooms are cleaned daily. Washer and dryer onsite. $2.00 each need quarters. Great location, really enjoyed Teddys burgers and Wolfgang puck, I would stay here again. Very close to beach and bus stops. The wifi in the hostel is excellent.

I really recommend this hostel!!! There in Waikiki boutique hostel everybody was so nice! Good people, good souls! I was like home. I went with only one friend but I returned to Argentina with 50 friends more! I'm so happy and thankful!!! I will come back!!!

Beautiful place!!!!!!! Andy very kind and Shoyen always friendly and plenty knowledge about the island. The Staff is always ready to help. You can know people all arround the world. Good breakfast. Nice and Quiet

Really enjoyed my stay at the Beach Waikiki Hostel. Stayed in a 4 bed female dorm and found it to be mostly comfortable and clean. It did get a bit cramped in the room at times but I didn't spend enough time in my room for it to really be a problem. The staff were helpful and friendly and there was plenty of information at the front desk about things to do, places to go for cheap/eats drinks etc. The free pizza and BBQ nights were great and helped save money (as did the free daily breakfast). Saying that though- get there ON TIME if not early for the food. I arrived at pizza night 10 minutes after 7 and only had 1 piece before it was all completely gone! I was lucky enough to make some good friends while I was there although I wouldn't exactly call this a party hostel. If you are a solo traveller like I was, put yourself out there and join some of the tours they run in house in order to meet people and make some buddies. Finally the location of this hostel is awesome. A 5 minute walk to the beach and the main drag. Overall, a good experience. I would absolutely stay in this hostel again!!

This hostel was in a safe spot which was very important as i was a solo female traveler. It was close to restaurants and the beach. The staff couldn't have been more helpful if they tried. I had a shared room with 3 other girls. Rooms were cleaned each day and having own bathroom was fabulous. Breakfast was basic but all that was needed. They had activity options available if you didnt know what to do I would stay there again without hesitation

Loved every moment here. It was my first time ever in a hostel and I've never felt more safe and at home. Very clean, house-keeping daily. We made some really great friends here! Staff is super friendly and helpful. Our favorite is Jose. They've got a ton of activities and places to see if you're stumped on what to do while you're there. The rooftop is very relaxing - free breakfast, a kitchen you can use and snacks at the front desk (the fruits were delish!). I would definitely go back.

Comfortable, clean, friendly. For the price, I can't imagine anything better. Beautiful rooftop hangout space, free coffee and PBJ's, and so close to the beach! Snorkel and beach gear, surf boards, etc. for rent. Staff was awesome. Andy, Shoyen, Jose, Tim, and Fernando, I'll miss your friendly faces. Will definitely stay here again next time.

This was my first time traveling in Hawaii. I came on my own, but left with friends. The rooms have their own bathrooms, A/C, and kitchenette with full-sized refrigerator. The rooftop, where they host lots of mixers, is where I made friends from all over the world. Everyone who works the front desk loves to help you love Hawaii just as much as they do. I got some great sightseeing tips from everyone there in between the conversations and jokes. Shoutout to Shoyen and Jose! Y'all made me want to turn my vacation into an indefinite stay... haha, and I know I wouldn't be the first. See you when I come back!

+Awesome location +Fridge cupboards microwave in room+En suite toilets and showers+Friendly staff +Free pizza nights and BBQ nights on the roof•Bed were a little creaky but not a problem- Breakfast time was 830-930 not great if you wanted to be out really early to do some long hikes but the selection was good.- Wifi was poor but I found this with both hostels I stayed in Hawaii (other one was the seaside hostel (7/10), this hostel was more 8/10.Would definitely recommend!

I spent two amazing months, everything was perfect from the location ( 2 min walking from the ocean) to the roof, the free pizza and bbq night.Also the staff is very friendly and helpful, i wanted to say hello to Andy Shoyen Tim Bleath Chris and the super cool Italian guy Giuseppe, hope to see you soon guys!

Clean rooms, comfortable beds, super friendly stuff and every day a lot of fun! The best think is location! 3 minutes walk from Waikiki!!! Close to shops, restaurants, and Starbucks... the best hostel I ever been :) Hope to come back one day!

I was very impressed with this hostel as they offer so much more for the same price than any other. I loved the beautiful roof top lounge, free pizza night, free catered in chinese dinner once a week each. Free beach mats, free beach chairs, free floaters, free wifi in the rooms. you don't have to pay every time you use your locker like others you bring your own lock, free laundry and bathroom soap, nice breakfast each morning on the roof top included. i loved the private patio off my room and had a nice time. The hostel was quiet compared to many others i walked by and the mattresses are comfortable. The locations was amazing with only minutes away from the beach and steps for all conveniences. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate every need. Dawn Shoyen, kyle, marie, tim, fernando were like family along with so many other nice people friendly, and help you with anything they could. So nice and refreshing to meet such wonderful people.

Location was perfect!. A minute from Waikiki Main Beach, shops, restaurants, and Starbucks ^^. I stayed other hostel before, but this hostel seem to have better facilities. Room with AC and bathroom was big plus and big refrigerator was in the unit! I stayed female dorm with 3 other roommates and feel very comfortable. Staff was very helpful. I recommend this hostel and will come back soon!

The Hostel is really nice. They have good breackfast and tuesday's pizza party and saturday's barbecue party good as well.The rooms are confortable.The only advertisement is about clean up but when I needed it, the staffs like Shoyen are caring. Beyond friendly and respectful.

Great location, but this is the obvious thing.The most important part is the people that makes a difference, the staff is very helpful, and makes your stay there a great experience.Shoyen: thank you so much!!! Great job at keeping the backpacking at the higher level.

This review is so overdue, but I have to share how great The Beach Waikiki Hostel really is! I stayed with them back in October for two weeks, and opted for the female room. Girls cycled in and out throughout my stay, but there were a few nights where it was just myself and one other female. The shared rooms have two sets of bunk beds and it reminded me of summer camp as a kid. I luckily had pretty chill roommates throughout my stay (one was super grumpy b/c she didn't want the air conditioner to be used, but HELLO, it's nearly impossible to sleep without the AC on and we all out-voted her). I have to be clear...this is a HOSTEL, not a hotel. If you're a priss and need 5-star accommodations, look elsewhere (and expect an incredible mark-up). Please also keep in mind that you are in Hawaii. With humidity that is pretty freakin high. If you've never been to a humid part of the world, mold grows easily in enclosed spaces. There was some mold in the shower, however I came prepared with some designated shower sandals (there's an ABC Store right around the corner if you need to pick some up). It kills me to read reviews of people saying this hostel is "filthy" when it's not. You have to be realistic and realize you're not staying at the Ritz Carlton. And that's part of the reason why the rates are insanely cheap! The staff are some of the sweetest people I have met while traveling. Suzie, Shoyen and Chris were awesome to chat and hang out with. They host various dinners and activities throughout the week, so staying here you have insta-friends to hang out with, if you'd like. I'm not 20 years old anymore, so meeting and hanging out with people was not my goal, but the offer to grab drinks or go out dancing was always there. I sometimes felt like a grandma, going to bed early so I could get up to enjoy the sunrise or go surf. I had a few roommates who stumbled back in the wee hours of the morning, but that is to be expected and didn't bother me too much. The location is perfect! A few blocks away from the beach, ABC Store, Starbucks and Teddy's Burgers (you MUST eat here at least once!!). The bus stop is a few minutes walk away (although they do run on Hawaii time, every so often). The rooms are cleaned lightly everyday. Lockers are provided, however you probably want to bring a lock to secure anything of value. I never felt like I had to worry about any of my roommates swiping anything, but it's better to be safe than sorry. A full-sized fridge is provided, which was great to be able to store food. There is a sink and stove in the room, however the hostel requests that you cook anything in the kitchen on the rooftop. Upon check in, you are given sheets for your bed. At first, I thought I was going to get too cold in the middle of the night, but you really sleep just fine without a comforter. I was also able to get a clean set of sheets after I stayed with them one week, I just brought them down to the front and got a new set.Breakfast is included, however I typically eat paleo and I heard all that was offered was toast and the like, so I skipped it. I was also on an acai bowl mission, so I was usually on the hunt for a new place to try a bowl (the best one I found included yogurt and macadamia nuts and was a 15 minute walk away, at Tilia Aloha Cafe). All in all, I had an awesome experience staying at The Beach Hostel. If you're up for an adventure, definitely consider staying with them! Mahalo for a great time, The Beach! :)

My friend and I spent a month in this hostel! The staff is super friendly and ready to help you in any means. From telling you about all the good places to eat local, good deals and all the cool little beaches/hikes! Super grateful to have stayed there and met super nice people! Shout out to Andy, Shoyen, Tim, Hayley, Fernando & Marie! Great location and cool hostel! Would recommend to any of my friends!

My friend and I stayed in a Junior Suite for 10 nights in February. I will start with the negatives of this hostel as, unfortunately, they far out weigh the positives.Cons:- Our room was FILTHY. We had to purchase cleaning products and disinfect the entire bathroom and most surfaces in the bedroom (including door knobs + light switches) prior to using anything. The shower curtain was also covered in mould. - The hot water could *sometimes* be unreliable. - We also purchased our own towels, as the ones we were given had a bad odour to them. - We weren't given any blankets, despite seeing other rooms with blankets. - The furniture was also filthy and worn out, the TV had marks all over it and desperately needed a wipe over. - However, my main concern is that half way through our stay the hotel staff decided that would be the perfect time to change the TV stand to a 'better' one (their word not mine). All of our food, beauty and hygiene products were on top of this stand (of course there was a towel we had bought between the surface of the TV stand and our products). They TOUCHED each of our belongings individually and MOVED THEM so that they could change the stand. I cannot even begin to tell you how wrong this is: firstly it is unhygienic and honestly disgusting, secondly it is unprofessional and lastly it was completely unnecessary (why couldn't they wait 5 more days until we had checked out to do this!?)- The atmosphere was horriblePros:- AMAZING wifi- Location was good, only a couple of blocks from the beach and a block from bus stops - Space to hang your towels outside- Fridge was clean- Lots of info on attractions, nightlife etc on a notice board opposite receptionUnfortunately the positives end there. If I were to do my time over I would have spent the extra $50 a night and booked a decent hotel rather than the 'junior suite'.

As I traveled by myself, I was nervous about everything, but staff members were so nice, friendly and they helped me a lot so I could stay here comfortably. Pizza night on Tuesday and BBQ night on Saturday were especially fun and gave me a chance to make new friends. I REALLY want to revisit this hostel and I definitely recommend you to stay here if you plan to travel to Oahu.

The location is perfect and staff are so friendly too!It's a great place to stay if you plan on spending most of your days out! So close to everything that you need as well.Shoutout to Dawn who helped me and my cousin check in earlier than the nominated check in time (it was a long flight, and she was very helpful and such a hard worker too).This was my second trip to Hawaii, Waikiki and I would definitely stay here again

Great location with the beach only being a 2 minute walk. Clean hostel, with a great vibe! Amazing friendly staff, Shout outs to Andy, Shoyen, Fernando, Tim, Hayley & Kyle :) Would recommend this hostel to anyone, would not hesitate to stay again if i ever return :)

The staff is amazing. It is very clean. I had such an amazing two weeks. Honestly, such an amazing hostel. I'm sad I didn't get to stay longer. Close to everything! Thank you so much! Andy, Shoyen, Blythe, Haley, Tim, Kyle, thank you for everything!

Hostel is in kinda old motel style building. It's your cheapest option in the area but after a night there we decided to get a nice hotel and be comfortable. It came w breakfast in the morning which consisted of toast and butter and jelly...

Although The Beach Waikiki boutique hostel may not be perfect, it is nevertheless the best budget option and the finest hostel in Waikiki. One just has to take a look around at the other hostels in the area, and The Beach comes out on top against any of its competition.Situated about a block from Waikiki beach and Kapiolani Park, the location is just about perfect. Everything you'll need during your stay, be it convenience stores, a grocery store, coffeeshops, bars, restaurants, shops, malls, etc, is within walking distance.Bus stop to the Ala Moana center is just a block away, so it's easy and convenient if you want to travel around Oahu. Staff is nice and friendly. But some people take it more seriously than others. Hence, your experience with the staffers may differ, especially if you're only there for a short stay. But I spent 8 nights there and it was all good.4-bed dorms are spacious enough and come with ensuite bathrooms. The bed frames can be noisy, but the mattresses are super comfy. Each dorm has its own A/C unit to keep it cool and comfortable at night. In terms of cleanliness, though the rooms are swept every day, they are not cleaned daily. I know our bathroom was only cleaned 2 or 3 times during my stay. It's not a major shortcoming for this hostel, as the place remains relatively clean anyway, but it is something that could be improved upon.Regarding the mixed dorms, The Beach is one of those hostels that advertize their existence, but essentially they only exist if you are a mixed group traveling together. After spending 8 nights in the hostel, I didn't meet a single guy who had a girl staying in the "mixed" dorms. I'm not too keen on single-sex dorms, which is why I always steer clear of HI properties. It would be nice to know that in essence, this is what you get here. Nothing wrong with that, but it's a bit disingenuous to advertize mixed dorms when there are none. Having at least one female roommate usually keeps guys cleaner and better behaved, which is why I habitually go for mixed dorms. . .You can borrow certain things for free at the reception, or rent surf boards and snorkeling gear for a nominal fee. Which is nice, as prices on the beach are not always cheap.The huge rooftop terrace is awesome It has its own kitchen, bathroom, and big-screen TV. It's a great place to hang out and meet other travelers. This is where the breakfast is served every morning. As nice as it is, however, it would be nice if there were other common areas where you could meet and chill with people.Speaking of breakfast, it is bare-bones, but it is free. It's basically only toasts and blueberry muffins. Nothing special, but it gets you going!Don't miss out on the free Korean BBQ night (Saturday) and on the free pizza and beer night (Tuesday). Both are fun, the food is good, and it's the perfect opportunity to meet other travelers.Though quiet hours are enforced at this hostel, the same cannot be said of the one next door (Polynesian Beach Club Hostel). This is a really ghetto hostel and it attracts a ragamuffin crowd. They can be pretty loud and obnoxious, often very late into the night. The night staffer from The Beach is supposed to monitor this and call the cops when that happens, but they're not always quick on the uptake. So if you can't sleep because it's too noisy, do go down and remind them that it's their job to make sure that their customers get to sleep at night.As far as the noise is concerned, please steer clear of Room 13. It's the corner room at the end of the front of the building, and it opens up to the courtyard of the Polynesian Beach Club. Where all the noise is coming from. For more peace and quiet, request a room in the back of the hostel. The front of the building, even if you are closer to the reception than Room 13, faces the valet parking area of the Queen Kapiolani Hotel. And those guys shout as if they were working on a construction site, so don't expect to sleep in come morning. The valet parkers begin their shift around 6:00am and then you can forget about peace and quiet. . . The back of the building probably is the best place to stay in order to get a good night's sleep.Free wifi works well. But they have 8 different networks, so sometimes you have to change networks for it to work for you, depending on where you find yourself in the hostel.Overall, this is definitely a good hostel offering very good value. No other hostel in Waikiki offers A/C in all its rooms. No other hostel in the area offers such spacious dorms with comfortable beds. No other hostel features such a cool rooftop terrace. And no other hostel offers all the free perks The Beach offers its guests.By far the best budget option in Waikiki!

I wasn't here for long enough to attend any social events but it seems there is a lot going on / good upstairs space to meet people. My room was very clean and I was happy with the bed as well. The best thing about this hostel for me was the location - great access to Diamond Head and of course Waikiki. That's the best value.The staff were pretty weird though. I was changing my booking on the day I was meant to check in and the girl didn't really seem to care or didn't want to explain to me the process of cancellations/charges. She wasn't rude but just kind of absent? Also weird to have a kitchenette in the rooms that aren't allowed to be used even though they are advertised. The rooms could also use some chairs.

Have just returned from a 5 night stay, and it was absolutely fine. I initially had booked the semi private room, with a shared kitchen and bathroom, but on arrival decided to upgrade to the private room, where you'll have your own bathroom and kitchen area. In hindsight it was definitely the right choice, for the little extra cost it's well worth doing in my opinion. Breakfast is included but but is a basic affair, simple bread/toast, with jam or peanut butter, and some small muffins, it's very much a DIY job, but it's adequate, and there are plenty of eateries in the area should you feel the need for something more significant. It's located in a relatively quiet backstreet, not on a main busy road, it feels perfectly safe, and is about 3-5 minutes from the beach, so that's all positive. Staff were always friendly and helpful, and if I came back to Honolulu again I would stay here. It's an expensive place for hotels, many with 'resort fees' on top of the basic cost, and as long as you're the type of traveller who spends most of the time out and about exploring the place, rather than lounging at the place where you're staying, it'll be easily adequate.

A nice and clean hostel with very friendly staff.They habe small dorms wirh own bathroom, toilet and fridge.It at the same street as the most hostels in that area.It's a short walk down to the beach and just next to the zoo.

Great place to stay for a couple of nights! Friendly staff and some nice activities in the hostel to get known eachother and sharing some beer as well as stories... The distance to the beach is very short and the sorroundings are a stone throw away.The rooms are clean and comes with a kind of a kitchen and a fridge. Lockers are in the room as well as a separate bathroom. Sometimes it's get a bit noisy because of party People and yes... it's a hostel.A taxi to the hostel costs about $30 - $45 but you can also use the Bus which is cheaper but takes more time to get to the hostel.Just around the Corner is a rental station for mopeds, which I highly recommend to get around the Island or just take the bus for $2,50...

This was my first time in Hawaii and staying at a hostel. Hailey booked my stay when I called and planned my trip and answer all my questions. Shoyen, helped welcomed me and my guest when we came to stay there into our very nice king bedroom suite, It was amazing. The hostel had and awesome vibe. I was able to walk to the beach, zoo and so many fun places that are extremely close to the hostel. I also took the bus which is very convenient if unable to walk there. The hostel was awesome with excursions, Chad who was the guide planned throughout my vacation. Rachel was cool as well. I miss Hawaii so much it feels like my heart is still there.

Stayed here five nights over the Honolulu marathon weekend. The website said it was booked up so I tried phoning and Shoyen said there was a bed available. On check in was given key to room 14. It was a pigsty with some guy's belongings strewn all over the floor. Looked like a long term resident lived in the room. I asked Shoyen at the front desk if I could stay in another room and thank goodness she moved me to another one which had better roommates. This hostel had a relaxed social vibe and a gathering place on the roof, small kitchen up there. Bunk beds in dorms, which are mixed gender. Not the cleanest place but I would stay there again. It's at the bottom end of Waikiki but the location is still good and close to the beach. Relatively quiet for Waikiki. Expect to meet Aussies, Kiwis, and Japanese here.

Although this was one of the more expensive hostels around Waikiki Beach, I'd say it was worth paying a bit more for. The rooms were airconditioned, and our room even had its own ensuite bathroom and small kitchen area. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the other guests were great.I have just a few small criticisms. Firstly, the rooms were not cleaned thoroughly enough each day. The floor of the room remained covered in sand for the entire time I was there. Although it was swept by the cleaner, it was a rushed job. Secondly, the internet connection was poor and constantly cut out. This was a big problem for me as I needed to work. Finally, it got pretty noisy at night.Nevertheless, would stay again.

I stayed there for 1 week in August.It was absolutely awesome.Not really expensive for what it is.Next to everything, the Waikiki beach, restaurants, zoo, museums, bicycle rent...(You also can rent surfboards in)The rooms are simples and cleans, and the staff very friendly.I loved my stayed there.

it was nice hostel! the only one with AC that i had in Hawaii. close to to the beach and to diamond head. The staff was awesome especially Sublimebeauty DawnShoyen. she was so nice and friendly, try to help with everything. and gave me a lot of recommendations what to do in Honolulu.

This was my first time staying in a hostel. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The AC worked well, and the shower was clean and hot. Every night I could find people going out and such. Most people were super chill and nice. I felt safe and like my stuff was secure. On that note, the lockers are small; only big enough for your valuables outside your bag.

I loved this hostel from the vey first second! starting with the staff (Cris, Shoyen), the rooms, the common areas. Close to the bus stop and the beach, cheap and clean. If you have a young spirit this is your place! 100% recommended!

I had such a great time at this hostel, it is one of the best I've ever stayed in. It is clean, in a great location and the atmosphere is so good! The staff are amazing, Shoyen is so lovely and accommodating. All of the staff are always helpful and so friendly, especially Hailey and Kris. I enjoyed my stay here so much and met so many wonderful people, I cannot wait to come back to this hostel again very soon. Highly recommend a stay at The Beach!

Great hostel with friendly staff, friendly people, free breakfast, clean rooms. Made lots of new friends from all around the world. They have beach and snorkel equipment to rent so you can save money. Pizza party and BBQ nights too for free! Would come again!

This was my second stay and certainly not my last. Excellent location, comfortable rooms and the staff are so friendly and helpful.The rooftop is an awesome place to hang and they do a couple of free dinner nights up there which is awesome.Lots of advise on activities to do.A relaxing, chill place that respects their guests.Highly recommend!

I absolutely loved this hostel !! I traveled with two friends and we had the best time. The hostel is right at the famous Waikiki beach! There are tons of restaurants and clubs. You can get to different places and beaches with the bus, which is super cheap it just takes a little longer sometimes. We were so lucky that we met chad, who worked at the hostel. One day he took us to the most beautiful places in Oahu with his jeep. He was an amazing tour guide and a really nice guy. The service at the hostel was great. It was always clean and if you needed help in anything, someone was always there to help you out. Shoutout to shoyen for all your help... You are such a great person ! This hostel is great for young people, who are looking for adventures and a youthful place to stay. I absolutely recommend this place!

Loved my stay here met so many cool people, some not so much but either way enjoyed my stay at this hostel and would definitely come back! I stayed for 5 days and had a private room, it was huge pretty much like a hotel room! Rooftop is awesome and I was there for the Tiesday free pizza night too! Sandy and Shoyen at the front counter were such helpful & lovely women, so down to earth & friendly and that's what u want welcoming you!! I'll be back in July can't wait!!

Pros: Staff is great, the environment is great, rooftop is awesome, the dinners they do are fantastic, the rooms are well-maintained and its proximity to the beach is wicked! Shoyen is the nicest too!Cons: Fills up fast! Book in advance people!

This place did the job, good roof top area to chill and drink. Close to the shops and beach which was good. Easy to find and good parking area of you have a car. Pretty chilled out staff and good knowledge of where to go and stuff. Overall pretty hostel.

The Waikiki Botique Hostle is super cute, super accomidating witha very friendly staff, especially Dawn. Clean rooms at the right price. I've reccomended it to friends and family who now feel the same. Aloha!

The staff is amazing / place is amazing. Shoyen / Josh and all are amazing at the hostel and very helpful in giving you directions or even taking you around! Don't think about staying at another place at all!

The Beach Boutique hostel was definitely the best hostel around Waikiki area. The vibe there is awesome Staff is so friendly, Next to Waikiki beach! Will definatly stay there next time! :) Aloha Hawaii

The Beach Boutique hostel was definitely the best hostel around Waikiki area. The vibe there is awesome as there are really cool and adventurous people visiting. The workers were also very welcoming, chill and helpful.And they have AC!!!!!!

One of the coolest and relaxed hostels I have visited. Friendly environment. Lots of social events on rooftop. Staff were helping beyond words! Josh and Shoyen were fantastic at front desk. Met some goods friends there!! Walking distance to beach and shops.

Stayed there in October '15. Location couldn't be better, it's right in the heart of Waikiki. Easy buses to Diamond Head or Hanauma Bay. You will want to rent a car ideally though, to tour the North Shore which is beautiful. And Pearl Harbor. The staff were exceptionally helpful and personable, especially Shoya and Susie. Good positive and enthusiastic welcome, just what we needed after such a long flight. People tend to gather on the roof in the evenings, so don't be shy, make sure you integrate. Traveling alone is no excuse for being lonely. The complimentary pizza and BBQ nights are great for bringing guests together. The only downside is that our aircon died during our stay. They did however get us a fan whilst they called an engineer to resolve it. It wasn't their fault either, hardware just fails sometimes. Recommended.

Excellent location, very close to beach, shops, restaurants and diamond head. The only thing better than the location was the staff. They were welcoming, friendly and always eager to assist with anything to help improve your trip. Shoyen was a great host. I would definitely stay again.

Great place, nice rooftop breakfast and fun dinners. Great location, just a block from the beach, walking distance to amazing shopping. Very friendly staff. Shoyen was very helpful and kind. I will stay there again ♡

First time at a hostel, I thoroughly enjoyed my time. The building was well kept, had a good vibe to it and free breakfast basics were offered everyday which was unexpected but was awesome to have. The staff at the time: Shoyen, hailey, levi, kalli were welcoming and very knowledgeable with the area. They pointed out best spots and informed of the more "tourist traps" and gimics that would be better to avoid. My room was always a cool temperature and never had any issues with it.

Had a great time at this hostel, met some amazing folks, staff was extremely helpful all day!! Memories I'll never forget!! Special Thanks to shoyen, josh and Hayley for making my experience a pleasant one! Hopefully we can hang out again someday!! Will def be back ;)Steve PeroMelbourne Australia

The Beach Waikiki Boutique is by far my favorit hostel on the whole island. it a quick stroll to the beach. The rooms are spacious with refrigerators, sink and stove. Bathrooms are high standard for a hostel. Free BBQ nights on there wonderful rooftop every tuesday and Pizza night Friday every week. Need I say more? Yes I do. The staff are amazing. Suzie, Hailey, and the ever so sweet manager Shoyen. These three drop dead gorgeous girls took very good care of me. This hostel is a real bang for your buck.Aloha Mr Green eyes.

I was very impressed with the room. Nice atmosphere and clean facilities. Most importantly the location of hostel was only one block from the beach. I was able to goto beach every morning and enjoy Waikiki Beach!!! Thank you guys!

It was amazing stay. Staff were super friendly and help almost every need. The room had AC, private bathroom, and even small kitchen! What I like the most was roof top lounge. At free activity night like BBQ night, it was great place to meet people. I highly recommend this hostel!!

Pros: great location, fun guests, and most of the staff were very friendly.Con: I got bed bugs while staying there. As a result I had to throw out my travel suitcase to avoid infecting my home with the things. Pretty horrible con in my opinion.Also the A/C is super weak (less effective than a good $20 fan). $34/night is kind of pricey for a hostel.

Great location, only a couple of blocks from the beach. Super friendly staff, happy to help with any questions or information. Rooms were spacious and clean, even had a fridge! I felt safe leaving my belongings at this hostel. The also offered a free BBQ dinner on Saturday night which was awesome when on a budget. Breakfast was simple and delicious. Would recommend for the budget traveller and I would stay again.

We stayed in a private double room with en suite. The location is great as it is about a block and a half from a quiet(er) section of Waikiki beach, with a choice of ABC stores nearby for when you want to stock up on supplies. We were able to walk to all of the places we wanted to go in Waikiki. The hotel is also just down the road from a bus stop that is serviced by the buses that go out to Pearl Harbour. Breakfast is included - basic but decent (toast, muffins and coffee). The staff members were friendly and helpful. We could not get internet to work in the room, however, but this was the only downside.

You can't beat the location for that price. The rooms are OK and - big plus - have AC. The common area on the roof is nothing really special but at least some place to meet. The breakfast was...well...it was there. Was OK for me but don't expect much of it. Nothing I could really complain about. Met some cool people but overall I had many Hostels which had just more vibe.

My first experience staying in a hostel so I was a little skeptical, however, I was pleasantly surprised!! I stayed in a female dorm with 3 other girls and the rooms have kitchen and air conditioning. The upstairs courtyard is very modern and a perfect place to enjoy the complimentary breakfast and meet others staying in the hostel. The staff were fun and helpful and everyone staying at the hostel was welcoming.I would definitely stay again if I return to Waikiki.

i found the hostel to be in a perfect location minutes from the beach restaurants public transport stops and ABC stores, friendly helpful staff and excellent rooms i stayed in a all female dorm with 4 beds, we had our own bathroom with small shower also a large fridge in the room with excellent AC, breakfast was on the roof coffee wasnt always available but bread and cakes were well it was for me im not sure about anyone else. i did a tour and i was picked up from just around the corner perfect location. wifi was acceptable as i was in a room furthest away from reception it work perfectly outside my room and most the time in the room.

review_body: I booked a stay at the Beach Waikiki Hostel weeks before my husband and I arrived. We made a booking for a private junior suite and paid a deposit. We're 30 years old and thought we'd have fun spending time around other people our age. When we got to the hostel, the guy at the front desk had my name in his system, but said he didn't have a room available and instead they had a room arrangement with the hotel next door. He gave us directions to the other hotel. It became pretty clear that the front desk person was voiding our reservation since my name was in the computer already. Since we had nowhere else to go on short notice, we went to the recommended hotel.Sure enough, the woman at the hotel next door said they had no such arrangement with the hostel. However, they did have a room available, so I stayed there because I had no other choice; all other last minute reservations would cost significantly more than I was planning to spend. Do not go to The Beach Waikiki Hostel if you have a problem with your reservation potentially being unexpectedly cancelled on the day you're planning to check-in for the first day of your vacation.

After reading the reviews of some of the other hostels I chose to fork out a little extra to stay here, glad I did, met a few people who had booked at the other hostels and were willing to for fit their deposit to stay here instead.. I stayed in a 4 share - female. bathroom was cleaned daily. bathroom was in room. clean. sheets were clean. enough charging points, fridge in room. roof top was nice - clean kitchen. free pizza night when I arrived, put on by staff. close to really tasty juice place. great location. I stayed 3 nights, I feel that was enough for that island. would recommend.

If you are looking for a superb location with the Most Excellent Staff, this very clean and quiet hostel is for you!! We couldn't not have asked for a more terrific holiday. Everyone welcomed us as if we were already part of their Hawaiian Ohana (family). The little extras like beach towels to rent, washer and dryer on property, roof top patio, pizza night, air conditioning were all very much appreciated. We miss the beach, but we also miss all the people we met during our stay. Mahalo (thank you) from Calgary!!

I stayed at the Beach for a month and I was travelling alone. I met so many amazing people there including the staff. After my month I was actually sad to leave the hostel. It's really a great place and I would definitely recommend this hostel to everyone who likes staying at hostels where people are sociable and just super friendly!

This Hostel was great, comfortable, tidy and not too noisy. The location is excellent- just a block back from Waikiki beach. Rooms are cleaned daily - the only recommendation i could give is a broom left in the rooms as being a block back from the beach we brought a lot of sand back into the rooms. The staff were very helpful and friendly, happy to recommend tours and give advice. I want to give a special mention to Chris, Levi and Josh - Absolutely wonderful staff member that made both myself and travel companion feel very welcome. The rooftop was a great place to hang out and meet people as was the little area out the front. I can't really fault this place - if you are looking for a hostel that isn't really rowdy and is clean i highly recommend this place. Also rated number one on Hostel world!

This hostel was gross. My bathroom smelled like something horrible, the solution to which seemed to be just to open the window. I was on the first floor so opening the window meant my shower was visible from the outside so my only option was to deal with the smell. My air conditioner was broken to the point where it was hotter inside the room than outside. I was told someone was coming to fix it but during my 11 night stay that never actually seemed to have happened. One of my last nights there, I had a GIANT cockroach in my room. Someone from the desk came and killed it and flushed it as though this was a normal occurrence. By the last day, I couldn't wait to leave my grimy, gross room.

review_body: Good things :- Bedrooms are cleaned every day.- Beds are confortable, not noisy.- A/C.- A lot of plugs to charge your iPhone/Computer.- Little box that u can use to store your valuable items with a locker.- Bathroom with a nice shower & hot water.- Nice breakfast.- Wifi.- Located in the heart of Waikiki.- Not a noisy place.- Hoven, fridge, microwave available in the kitchen.- 24/7 staff available at the reception. Things to improve:- Hostel staff must be aware about how to get from a place to another in Hawaii. Buses, metro etc...- I had the chance to go on a tour with Chad also called " Mike " on the Northern Shore, I wish it was a weekly tour because I truly believe that the guests would really enjoy it.- Wifi connection must be improved. I couldn't have network in some parts of the hostel.My overall experience there was pretty nice. The hostel is clean, safe, well located with a wonderful staff who carry this place on a daily basis. Thumb up to the Manager and Chad also called ' Mike'. :)

Came as a solo traveller, found this to be a great and cosy place to stay. My room was also kindly upgraded when I arrived. Plenty of activities to do at the front info desk - the hostel also runs some social nights like free pizza night which is great. There's always something to do. Perfect location not far from Waikiki beach!

Really impressed with our stay here. Such a unique hostel with lots of homely touches. We had a private double room. Everything was clean, we had lovely silk sheets and a kitchen area. Towels were provided and we had a porch out the front. Reception were really helpful with coordinating our stay and suggesting activities. The location could not be better, 2 minute walk to the beach, 5 minute walk to the center of Waikiki. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed at this hosel for 16 days and was really impressed with it. Clean rooms and common areas, friendly staff and generous Tuesday night pizza and Saturday night BBQ. Roof top terrace is lovely and location of hostel, just one block from the beach, is awesome. Highly recommend the Waikiki Beach Hostel for those on a budget wanting a place to stay in Wakiki.

I am engineer and 39 years old from Norway. I have stayed at this hostel 4 times on my 4 times visits at Waikiki. This hostel is a cosy home alike hostel, to many travellers just like me. It's situated in a perfect location at Waikiki, so easy to get around. Thanks to the excellent management that the staff (who are mostly travellers themselves, just like you and I) provide VERY good service to the guests. They are very helpful and friendly. They are knowledgeable about places and general info about Oahu. The hostel is generous enough to invite the guests for free pizza and barbecue night every week. I would rate this hostel 5 out of 5 for the best hostel at Waikiki (rating the place, environment, facilities and service). Those who complained about this place are mostly those who expect a 5 stars hotel facilities and service(no offence to anyone). Enjoy your stay at The beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel.

I was a cautious, optimist prior to staying at this hostel. Quite frankly my first stay in a hostel this one was a charm. Parking was very reasonable for this area at 10 bucks with a queen size bed, a full size bed, private shower, a kitchenette and more square footage to boot than the EWA hotel a couple of buildings down had to offer. This hostel offers a simple daily breakfast on the roof top with a bbq on Saturdays and Tuesday pizza night! Ok ok I can deal with no house keeping on a daily basis that most hotels offer in the neighborhood .This place offers more of a home feeling than other places. All staff that I interacted with was friendly and helpful when called upon! The shower drain was backed up first time I tried to shower. The problem was not attended to prior to my checking out. I guess the happy medium is the hostel has a private shower at the rooftop. At the end of the day I would stay at this hostel on my next visit! Gracias

Loved saying at this place. Felt really welcome and at home here. Everyone was really friendly, especially the reception staff. Josh was really helpful every time I had a question about certain sights and local attractions. Very friendly as well. I would definitely come back here! I've stayed at dozens of hostels throughout travels over the years and The Beach Boutique Hostel is definitely top 3! Would definitely recommend.

It was an awesome hostel with a great roof top terrace AND just a block from the beach. Callie who checked me in was very welcoming and helpful. She definitely made me feel like I was at home :) Josh was also very helpful and approachable. He brought some great vibes to the hostel with his music and macadamia nuts. All in all great hostel and amazing staff.

If we wish to have a place for a sleep for few hours with a reasonable price then your choice must be this. There are locker facilities, rooms with AC, wifi, bed and break fast, easy assess, near to the popular places what else you need in Hawaii.

This was my first time staying in a shared hostel and I completely enjoyed it. Stayed in a four bed room which was comfortable and clean. Each room has its own bathroom and kitchen which has everything you need. The beds are a big single, soft sheets and comfortable.The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating.Good price, free breakfast, activities, pizza nights and wifi (although it drops sometimes).Will defiantly be returning one day

After backpacking for 6 months.. This place doesn't feel like a hostel. Friendliest staff (let us camp out for a few hours in the middle of the night days before we checked in.. We were bussing to the north shore). Free breakfast! Tuesday night was free pizza.. This was like a grade school pizza party. They probably ordered 20 large pizzas. The wifi is free. Rooftop is awesome. AC is great in the rooms and the rooms are huge! Book well in advance because they're always full.

We've been in Waikiki for almost 4 weeks and in the first week we tried out some other hostels and "The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel" was definitely the best hostel. Awesome staff, very friendly and helpful. We had a lot of fun so that we can even say, we found some friends during our stay. Clean rooms with comfy beds. A great roof deck with plenty of space to sit and chat with other roomies. It is also the place to get some free stuff - bbq, pizza night once a week and lots of other stuffs, that help you to get in touch with other people. Not to forget there is even free breakfast and free wifi!You can rent snorkeling gear and the manager also helped us to rent a car for driving to the North Shore. So don't hesitate, this hostel is the best decision to spend your holidays in Waikiki.

Stayed in a dorm, 4 beds, with a bathroom AC and a fridge. Nice roofterrace and nice staff. Would def recommend this place! Wednesdays are pizzanight (pizzahut pizzas) and saturdays bbq, for free!Pentry up on the roofterrace allors u to make your own food. Only negative thing is that the breakfast coffee is way to weak, looks like tea, but who really cares?!

Perfect for Price! Very convenient location - close to the beach and other tour activities. Really nice and helpful staff. Have events on the rooftop deck - fun way to meet other travelers. Rooms were standard and clean.
