review_body: The serivce was pretty good, the manager tried his best & was polite. When we first arrived, we were supposed to be staying at the nicer hotel accom but for some reason the room wasnt available come time to check-in in the afternoon, so we stayed the first night in a very dingy room & the aircon leaked water everywhere, blew hot humid air & wouldnt even turn off, however the manager compensated us for the night. The mattresses are extremely thin & uncomfortable. Was not what i had expected from the website and pictures of rooms. But location is handy and the rooms were clean. Was disappointed that there is a 'kitchen' in the room but cant be used at all. We thought we'd pay more for a private room with usable kitchenette. Manager was nice enough to bring us a kettle and bowls to use. Service great, accom...not what we expected for what we paid. Then again, it is Waikiki.

This was my first hostel experience overseas and in pretty certain I was spoilt! The rooms are very basic but provide you with everything you need for a memorable trip. I stayed in room #2. We had 3 sets of bunk beds, which didn't squeak as much as I thought they would, a set of small lockers (really only big enough for passport, paperwork and a few personal items), a large cupboard, a standard but clean bathroom and a decent sized fridge out side. The hostel would put on a BBQ on a Saturday night and a pizza night on a Tuesday on top of the rooftop. This is how I got to meet so many amazing new people who soon became my new hiking buddys. The rooftop closes at 10 which would usually mean guests would go to their outdoor settings (usually a table and a couple of chairs) back at the room to continue their evening. The staff were amazing. The desk is maned 24/7 so if I ever had an issue they were there to help out. This came in handy with my flight delays and constantly having to call them and change my booking which they did with out any hassle. Not only did they help with my accomodation they also provided us with hints and tips on what to see, where to see it and how to get there, which was very handy with trying to work out bus routes. Sheets and a pillowcase/pillow were provided on arrival. The only thing you'll need to complete your room, As an additional extra, is a lock for your locker. I gave it 5 stars, even though the furniture isn't what you would see at Hilton, because as a backpacker it's everything you want and need for that type of experience. If you want a luxury holiday with a spa bath and room service this obviously isn't the place for you. But if your looking for a cheap room to store your belongings in and to crash in after a big day of exploring then this is the perfect place!

The hostel was brilliant, from the moment I arrived I was greeted by the biggest smiling faces. Jay on reception checked me in and was so helpful and friendly. Every second word was 'awesome'. I thought to myself, this place is great. The rest of the staff were really great too, most of them travellers just like myself, and there was a filipino lady who worked there too who pointed me out straight away, (you can always tell another filipino) and she was great. Most of these people i'm lucky enough to say are now my friends.The hostel itself was refurbished, clean and had a cool roof terrace which was great for meeting new people. I will definitely be staying here when I return in July next year.Aloha

This hostel is the best hostel in Waikiki....Ever! as it is clean and tidy, well maintained and the staff are super accommodating. They have pizza and pub nights. Helpful to point you in the right direction in your travels while in waikiki. "to the beach" I have stayed in a few different places in Waikiki, but this is the only hostel I Chose to return to because I like it that much.All the best in your travels & choose to be happy where you are. BTWHostel ROCKS!

The owner and staff discriminating me lying about my person, calling the cops because i wont change rooms for a 3rd time y 2 days.There are travelers doing drugs here, if you want to have a good time, don't come here.They are un-profesional. Don't worth the money.Good thing: cheap and close to the beachBad: discrimination personal.

When most people hear the term hostel they become concerned about the accommodations and the people one will encounter. This was my fist solo trip, and first time traveling to Oahu, and at first I felt very excited yet nervous. The staff were extremely eager to assist me and to make my stay as pleasant and memorable as possible.  Remember that this is a hostel. You will encounter many solo travelers who share the same interests, and who are eager to explore the island. I always found people to share a car with or to hop on the bus with and travel around the island. For those who are interested in running and cycling, this hostel is across from a beautiful park and muscle beach, only a five minute walk to Waikiki beach with equipment rentals at the hostel, a 10 minute walk to food land supermarket, and the two ABC shops right around the corner.  Free Pizza night on Tuesdays, free BBQ night on Saturdays, organized volleyball and soccer games, and most memorable were the nights spent cooking meals together with the many friends I made at the hostel.  I look forward to my next trip to Hawaii and will certainly stay at this Hostel again. I arrived alone but left with many memories , stories, and photos with friends I made at this hostel. Special thanks and Mahalo to the owner Andy, and to the dedicated staff Shoyen, Hailey, Abby, Chad, Lara, and Nahum for an amazing time!!

I was staying at hotel for the first two nights, but found it inconvinient because of the price and other things.n I found out this place, n it was a good experience as I could enjoy socializing at the rooftop, n the staff was friendly too.If u come here for visit with friends or by urself, I definitely recommend this place for staying few nights in wikiki.

It's not really a huge saving money wise against a hotel room, my advice would be to look for a couple of things in a hotel, then pick the best value. Staff: the staff here are friendly, but they are not professional, it seems like temporary holiday staffers not full time service industry professionals. We'd a few bad experiences. Location: the location is decent, but it's all the way at the end of waikiki, so for access to the strip, or shopping, pick somewhere closer to ala moana. Noise: it's noisy, lots of people noise. Rooms: we had an air con unit running all night but it wasn't right, as it was still to hot to sleep. Bad experience for us. Not going to get into petty conversations again with management via here as I did in person. Own up to making mistakes and fix them, stop using the line "for our guests" as excuses for everything. My advice is to avoid.

I stayed here for two nights in a private room. Whilst the room is well equipped with a kitchenette and bathroom, the place is very grubby and run down. I know it's only a hostel so I wasn't expecting a lot! But the bathroom had a serious mold problem, it smelt terrible, I could hardly breathe in there. My room was also right next to the laundry, and even though it is stated that laundry hours stop at 10pm at night, people proceeded to do their laundry until 2am in the morning, which is not cool! So noisy.There was hardly anyone up on the rooftop common area. The hostel did not have a great social vibe.Whilst the location was ok, it is still a little far from the main action of the Waikiki area.I wouldn't stay here again.

Free breakfast in the morning was a huge bonus, I was able to find free Street parking every night or you can park in front of the hostel for $10 per night, my second time in a hotel as really had no complaints

Very helpful and friendly staff, decent breakfast, good hostel lead events. The cleaner generally comes in and just empties the trash instead of actually cleaning the bathroom. Squeaky beds that make lots of noise no matter how little you move. Good enough location: 30 min walk to diamond head, across the street from the zoo, close to the beach, 15 min walk to nearest supermarket. Have a very nice common area on the roof, not the best place in the rain though. A good hostel that I would go back to.

Everyone has different core needs when travelling and this place ticked off nearly all my boxes. Travelling solo, l found home away from home with the most amazing and friendly staff l have ever encountered in my travels. The team lead by Andy were respectful, culturally aware, helpful in activities suggestions and flexible. Rooms are cleaned everyday, great security with CCTV cameras at most angles and on top very affordable. I am sure to book in there again on my next trip soon. Big shout out to Shoyen, Abby and Hailey for making my stay memorable. In Aussie lingo we say, 'you lil ripper or beauty'

You just can't beat this location! Right off the hotel strip and close to make attractions. The hostel has all sorts of equipment for rent. Room is clean and A/C works well. The bathroom however smells funky and shower could use a good scrubbing. The free breakfast is bread, mini muffins and peanut butter & jelly. The overall crowd staying there is not too loud.

This was my first hostel experience, and it was amazing! I got in pretty late on my first night, and Andy, the manager was at the reception desk. He was super friendly, and helpful! He even helped me with my bags to my room! The rooms are very clean and spacious. I was happy to find that the mattress was comfy too :) One of my favorite things about this hostel is the roof top! It is a new addition to the hostel, and it's a great place to hang out and mingle around with the other guests! This hostel is the best because of the staff. Andy, Shoyen, Abby, Hailey, Lara, chad, and Nahum are all super helpful and wonderful people :) They like to get to know the guests, exchange stories, and even take the guests out on all kinds of adventures. I recommend this hostel to anyone, and I will hopefully be returning again soon. xoxo - Jamie ;)

I stayed a week at the hostel and I have not complains, nice environment for young people. If you are an older person planing to go bed at 8 pm that wont happen, the place is full of energy and good vibes. everybody was very kind and attentive, very close to the stores and of course to the beach. It was a good experience I am planing to comeback this year. did i mention the very attractive girls working there that is a plus ... thanks DawnShoyen.

It was just great. Rooms are very nice. Location is great, And the staff is super nice. Yen is really helpful. She brought me a note from another guest because we didnt exchange numbers or even roomnumbers. It was really funny. I woke up and was wondering how the note came in my bed :DIt was a really good time at this hostel!!!!!!! I highly recommend to stay there!!!!

Stayed here for 10 days and absolutely loved it! Rooms are great and the location couldn't be better! Staff are really friendly and helpful, they really make you feel like family. Thanks Yen for all your help and awesome travel tips! Definitely recommend this place and will be back!

just stayed in the Waikiki beach boutique hostel for five nights with a friend. We were booked into the 4 bed female room. When we checked in we found that this room is right behind the reception desk. The room was filthy - overflowing bins, fridge full of out of date food / drinks, and COCKROACHES!!!!!I don't expect a hostel to be amazing (although the ones in Europe I have used have been great) but I do have a few basic expectations: clean bathroom and room, lights that work (of the two only one worked and was right above a girls bunk) and the room to be quiet enough to sleep... which this was not. As this room was behind the reception desk people would gather through the night to drink and chat with the staff... and play ukuleles!!! It also became clear during our five night stay that staff used this room as a staff room; unlocking the door to use our bathroom during the day, coming in unannounced to access the cleaning cupboard or to store luggage for other guests.When I told the Fijian girl on the desk about the cockroaches she just said, 'I couldn't clean yesterday because you locked the door'. Of course we locked the door when we went out, all our things were in there, otherwise why issue is with a key?! She was lying anyway as the previous day 'someone' had unlocked the door and left some luggage in the room and it didn't belong to my friend or I or either of our other roommates.Basically for what this hostel charges you can get a motel room slightly further from the beach in Waikiki. I'm by no means picky about hostels but this is one of the worst I've seen. The two pros of the place are Hailey on reception - super helpful and friendly and can give you tips of where to go and where to avoid; and that the beach is literally a five minute walk away!Other than the noise, filthy room and useless staff (except Hailey) I'd also warn you that the breakfast included is damp muffins (left in the fridge to go soggy overnight), coffee, tea and toast. You're better off spending $10 for a breakfast buffet to keep you going all day. I'll definitely be back to Waikiki in the future but will be finding another hostel or hotel!!

I've stayed at this hostel twice now for about 3 weeks each vist and it was by far the best experience I've had! I travel a bit and hostels are usually my first choice of accommodation. This hostel is the nicest one I've stayed at. All the staff is super friendly, and the owner Andy and one of the workers Yen even remembered me the second time I visited. The rooms are kept nice and clean and theres air conditioning wich is a definite plus. And they fed us breakfast each morning and hosted pizza night and bbq night each week. Also Waikiki beach is literally 2 blocks away!!If you're visiting waikiki and need an affordable nice place to stay then I highly recomend The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel :)

Perfect location. Clean comfy rooms. Nice people. Awesome rooftop terrace and free food/drinks. Felt at home the minute i enter the hostel. Rad crew and manager. Fun and bubbly Shoyen and Lara makes you want to stay at the front desk all day. Seriously best hostel i've stayed in all my travelling years!

great hostel! One of the best I've ever stayed in. Clean, great location, awesome rooftop area! Night activities and helpful, friendly and informative staff. This is definitely the best hostel in waikiki as I have also stayed at the others. I highly recommend this hostel!

We loved our stay in this hostel. The service was amazing. The rooms were clean, warm, and inviting. Our favorite part about this hostel was the rooftop. Having breakfast every morning with everyone around the world staying here. Not to mention the free pizza night every week! One of the employees stood out to us in a positive way. Her name was Yen. She had a great personality which made us feel welcomed. We highly suggest staying here during your visit.

The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel is by far the best hostel on Oahu. Its actually cleanest and friendliest Hostel I ever stayed in and I have traveld the world and stayed in many Hostels. Well equipped rooms with.brand new microwave s and.refrigerater and freezer. Nice bathrooms and showers very clean. The staff are so awsome, kind and helpfull they really make you feel att home. Shoyen the assistant manager is so funny nice and helpfull. Abby and Hailey are awsome as well. Both so sweet and helpfull. Oh I cant forget Andy the owner he is so nice and funny. These people really make you feel att home. Come to the Boutique hostel the.best one in hawaii hands down :)

Clean, comfortable, friendly, affordable. 1 block from Waikiki Beach. A rate for a private room can't be beat! Shoyen, an employee at the hostel is super friendly and helpful! Wonderful experience. Highly recommended!

I stayed in the hostel for a week and it was brilliant, got breakfast in the morning and dinner on the pizza and BBQ nights. The location is perfect and the hostel atmosphere was class, a very social hostel with a top deck perfect for a few drinks at night (or during the day) the staff were top notch, they knew their stuff and were always helpful and lovely. I will come back as soon as the banks give me more loans ahha

Great and friendly staff, was a pleasure anytime I had to talk with anyone who worked there. The location is excellent - just off Waikiki beach (2 mins away) and in a quiet street without too much traffic. The hostel was very clean when I was there for five days and there were a few fun activities to sign-up for out there. The rooftop area is expansive and great. Breakfast & wifi quality were a bit lacking, but those are my only complaints.

Came here for 13 days! Had the best time. The guys at reception are so welcoming and helped with anything! Bbq and pizza nights weekly which are great for meeting other people! Lovely roof top terrece. Defiantly recommend and would come back in an instant!

Great hostel, great rooftop, friendly and helpful staff. Free Pizza and bbq night help to save on your wallet. Nightly activities. Highly recommend staying. I need to use the last of my characters up in this message. Twenty more to go. Done.

Loved staying here when I wanted to see the best of Hawaii. The wooden bunk beds are the best because they don't squeak like the horrible cheap metals ones at other nearby hostels and are very comfortable for a perfect restful night. Reminds me of nice European hostels I have stayed at. Very quiet and safe area. I love the suggestions of where to go around the island. All hostels should have activities scheduled because the way to truly experience Hawaii is with a trustworthy and insightful invidual. I loved the big closets in the room too cuz having to maneuver all your bags to not block a bed or rungs to top bunk can be frustrating. The sweet staff does everything possible to make your stay perfect. Definitely check out the lovely upper deck. It is a nice private treat to get to know your fellow hostellers and talented staff. Mahalo Plenny

Staff is friendly and helpful and the location is great...BUT...We got placed in the room directly behind reception. It's constant noise. This is clearly a room for staff that we were placed in as the hostel was overbooked. People are always at reception talking, playing the ukelele or there is general noise all hours of the day and night. Staff came into our room without knocking to get supplies out of the closets, cupboards and fridge. I don't think our room has been cleaned once since we checked in besides sweeping the floor. There is currently a giant dead cockroach on the floor and our bathroom could use a good scrub and airing out. So many empty bottles in our shower and the shower curtain reeks. One of the girls in our room said she came in one day to someone else using our bathroom! We have come back to the room being unlocked or the door wide open. This is completely unacceptable and after paying $200 for 5 nights, i can positively say i will not be returning.

This hostel was great -- it was very clean and inviting. The location really is perfect, Waikiki beach is your backyard when you are here and the buses stop right outside. Hailey + abbey at the front desk and we're really considerate and answered all of my questions every day on where to go and what to do. They fostered a great sense of community at the hostel. They really want you to have a fun time and they were my favorite part of staying here. Chad takes guests to north Shore twice a week -- for free. Seriously, being here was like staying in a five star resort with my own concierge. I think it's really neat that a hostel has such good "customer service" -- they clearly really care about the comfort of the guests coming through. Maholo!

I don't normaily write reviews but had to after staying here. My stay at the Beach was the best! First off, the girls at the front desk make for a super fun, hip atmosphere. Some of the staff even live on site so they are around 24/7 to help with anything. They actually were more like friends than staff. A guy who works there too takes the guests on tours with his car for FREE too so you can see that they really care about their guests. Secondly, the place is just one and and a half blocks to then beach so the location no is superb and it's super clean and decorated with surf boards and tiki torches so it's really cute! Lastly, there is a killer rooftop deck to hangout on....I definitely be back!!

This hostel is far from clean. the floors and bathroom were filthy our entire 7 night stay. The girls n the front desk are not friendly at all. I usually find it quite easy to meet people at hostels but not this one. I hear that a lot of the other hostels have a better atmosphere than this place. Tried booking car hire and tours through the front desk and found it way cheaper at the street vendors. The location is great and I also loved that we had a full sized fridge(which was surprisingly clean) and lockers. Beach equipment for hire was also a nice addition. Also you can only access wifi in common areas and even then it's really slow and constantly drops out.

I moved here after doing a a few nights at a hostel on the opposite street. If I wasn't only staying a couple more nights and hadn't already paid, I definitely would've moved back. If you're looking for a nice, clean, well designed hostel, this is the place for you. It's quite a nice set up and is pretty luxurious as a far as hostels go. But i think its the only hostel along this street (Cartwright). And I didn't find the staff as friendly as the previous one I stayed at. They were polite but it always seemed like they were focused on something else, sometimes even getting a "hello" back was difficult. If you're looking for a hostel with lots of atmosphere, friendly staff and great people, try the opposite street (lemon). There's several hostels on that side and the vibes are completely different. I had an okay stay at this hostel, but as far as the atmosphere, it didn't really do much for me.Wouldn't stay again, but I'd recommend it if you're looking for a clean and quiet stay.The wifi only worked well on the roof, not in the room.

This is the second time I have stayed here but the first under new management. I would stay nowhere else. The staff are friendly and helpful and it is in a great location being just minutes from the beach. The rooms are clean and spacious and usually not full. The rooms have a kitchen and en suite. The only possible negatives is if you are a bad sleeper and are across from the Queen Kapiolani Hotel bike rental/back door.... it gets noisy! but I can sleep through it.I can't wait to return and feel the Aloha spirit here.

Great people! Fantastic Location! Excellent staff and the people that stay there make the vacation. From the moment I walked in the door, I felt welcome and included. The location is so close to the beach. The rooms are a bit untidy, and I don't think they came and cleaned too often. Our bathroom was pretty gross. But, it's a hostel, not the Hilton and you get what you pay for. The rooftop patio and free pizza / BBQ nights were great. I had a Fantastic time!

I stayed for two nights, from the 6 to the 8 of December. On my experience it was great! Met very nice people, the staff was very nice too and the service was good. I would definitely come back and recommend it. Also the the place is very close to the beach, so the location was excellent.

this is a nice,clean hostel,close to Waikiki beach,just 5 minutes away to the beach.The stuff is very friendly and helpful. It is relatively quiet,although the mainroad is around the corner. The single rooms are big and equipped with a fridge and microvave and an oven to cook something.Every single room has a bathroom ensuit too.

Very friendly staff and chilled atmosphere. We arrived two days early, staff allowed us to store our bags early and upgraded us when we did eventually check in to a private room. Free pizza Tuesday's & free bbq Fridays. What more needs be said, this place is well worth the visit!

I will confess: this was my first hostel experience. That being said, I might be hooked! Location was perfect for accessing the beach, shopping, bars, and nature. The staff were genuinely nice and informative. Even helped me with my luggage!The room was clean and recently updated. I slept comfortably in my top bunk.The rooftop terrace was a nice bonus and a great way to meet other guests. You can't beat this place for the price. I would highly recommend it!

If you go to Honolulu, stay at The Beach Waikiki Boutique Hostel ! Fantastic place, from there is very easy acces to see all those "must to do & to see" in Honolulu. Hostel has clean rooms, fantastic roof terrace where you enjoy your breakfast for free :) very nice staff, 5 minutes to Waikiki Beach, breakfast included and sometimes dinners ( Pizza evening, BBQ evening - you can meet people from all over the world and taste dinner for free :), cheap ABC shops just around the corner, very easy acces from airport ( local bus number 19 or 20 and 2 minutes from the bus stop is hostel :) You can go to Arizona Memorial by local bus ( rather long journey by local bus - about 1,5 hour, but you can observe locals :) You can walk to Diamonds Head ( volcano) by foot - about 2-3 hours, but it is worth, beautiful coast views, houses with exotic plants. If you want to go for shopping there is also short distance from hostel and you can buy at Gucci, Victorias Secret, Luis Vuitton and so on , and so on...For sure I recommend this hostel !

A small group of us from China had a wonderful 5 day stay . Just one block to Waikiki Beach and all the clubs and great restaurants just a few blocks away . The Hostel was very clean with a very nice staff everyone was wonderful our room was better then expected with a little Kitchen . The best part was the people we met , We all rented a car to do a tour to the north shore . We all loved this Hostel

My girlfriend and I have stayed in hostels all over the world and this definitely ranks as the worst level of service and lowest value for money I can remember anywhere. Firstly the pros; the location is excellent in relation to Waikiki, a short walk to all shops restaurants and very close to the beach and bus routes. The room itself (we stayed in a double bed private for 7 nights) was clean, spacious, comfortable and all have a full size fridge. The cons; The level of customer service we received can generously be described as non-existent. The staff were disinterested, distinctly unhelpful, unaccommodating and at times rude. This ranged from simply ignoring you while you are waiting to be served right in front of them at reception, to unapologetically informing you there was no more coffee or butter available for breakfast to a complete lack of friendliness or enthusiasm. There are numerous more specific examples of this unhelpfulness however a quick glance of some of the other comments on this page will tell you all you need to know. Honestly all this is debatably acceptable if we were paying much less but at almost $130 per night for a private that is a complete and utter joke. Which is where another one of our gripes comes from, when booking this room on hostelworld the price of the room is only $108 and the wording lead us to believe that taxes were included in that however we received a little bit of a shock on arrival to be informed that our room was intact much more expensive than we thought, we're not new to prices not including taxes so this may well have just been an oversight from us but i definitely feel we were mislead by the wording and have booked many times on hostelworld without ever having paid taxes after, at the very least this is something people should be aware of. Bearing that in mind, for $130 per night you expect your room to be cleaned daily, which it was not or for the sheets to be changed at least once, which they weren't, in fact one day we returned to the room to find the sheet scrunched into a ball and left in the middle of the bed which we found very strange. For that price it would also be reasonable to expect a shower where the handle wasn't falling off the wall, or to have reliable hot water (we went three consecutive days without), or even more strangely when the description of your room says 'kitchenette' but does not contain a single knife, fork, plate or anything even resembling a kitchen utensil.It is a total mystery where the 'boutique' comes from in the title. This is basically a overpriced, dated, american country town style motel with staff that would be better suited to a job that didn't involved any sort of customer service.Honestly, if you're willing to pay the money our experience is that you will get a decent room in a good location but nothing else. If we had our time again we would stay elsewhere, particularly as there is two other hostels on the next street and infinite apartment options nearby for the same price.

This is a great hostel! It is in a great location just two blocks from Waikiki Beach. It is in walking distance of bars, restaurants, grocery stores, etc.The staff is very friendly, social, helpful, and knowledgable. The rooms are clean and air conditioned. It has a great lounge area on the roof with a kitchen, big screen TV, and attractive wooden tables and chairs. Saturday nights the guests are treated to a free BBQ with excellent homemade food. While staying there I met travelers from all over the world, and it was very easy to make friends. It is a great place to stay while visiting Hawaii. Check it out!

Firstly, I am not new to hostels in the past 6 years I've stayed at 3 other hostels on Oahu(also: others throughout Washington, Oregon & Britsh Columbia).I suppose my negative impressuons could have been partly my misinterpreting the inviting, hopeful marketing terms such as: 'boutique hostel' or 'reopen with upgraded facilities July 1, 2014' may have made me conjure up some impossibly irrealistic fancy/tropical/modern/neo-froufrou dream hostel in my mind...lol. I must say that the girl who had checked me in was awesome - good customer service, she seemed genuinely friendly & welcoming. However, I came crashing back to classic sketch hostel reality with a thud when (after a rather late flight and a not so "speedi" shuttle) after I struggled to drag my admittedly ridiculous amount of luggage up a daunting flight of stairs & around the entire circumference of the hostel to my dorm I probably wasn't in the best frame of mind to appreciate the small room consisting of 2 bunk beds, a wonky ill laid out kitchen and a tiny dirty extremely poorly planned bathroom (you literally had to squeeze between the sink and a narrow gap to access a small rather filthy shower). I was exhausted by the time I'd finished making my bed and while i'm not thrilled about a top-bunk situation, happily the mattress was comfortable. The new looking AC unit definitely worked in that room(it was freezing and the sheet provided wasn't cutting it...strange to complain about AC in a hostel.) Even in the morning light I struggled to see how that room could possibly have been upgraded? What specifically was upgraded and by whom? I think the flooring must have been upgraded, but had noone maintained it since the reopening in July? The luggage of the other 3 girls strewn about every available wall and corner didn't help the situation. Luckily, I didn't see any bugs (and at that point I certainly wasn't about to go searching for them). No security concerns I was aware of - I felt safe in the hostel.At first glance, the rooftop patio looked fun & felt boutique-y (especially for a hostel) but after a closer inspection when I sat down to eat the complimentary toast the counter felt/looked grime-y...it didn't help that previous guests hadn't bothered to clean up after themselves and birds were scavenging the plates, darting about the seats & tables. Not the end of the world, but kind of disappointing because if it weren't so superficially grungy - it would've been a pretty impressive common area.I didn't take any pictures to reflect on, but I think it partly could be that I was unable to get the luxe fantasy hostel out of my mind...after all I'd only stayed one night so my initial perspective may have softened with a jaunt to the beach(it is nearby), getting settled and meeting some of the fun, interesting travelers I'm sure we're staying there...pizza & beer couldn't have hurt either.If you're travelling solo, a bed here is still considerably less $ than the cheapest of Waikiki hotel rooms...some of which probably have more bugs and less comfortable mattresses.In summation, I'm not saying don't try this hostel, I'm just recommending to do so with less emphasis on boutique and more emphasis on hostel.

This hostel was basic, at very most. It looks like a typical american motel. The room contained 4 beds and a small kitchen. Some people in my room had been living there for a while - their stuff was everywhere. Seemed like a good party hostel in the downstairs area. Besides that, very simple, beds were relatively comfortable and clean bedding is given once you sign in. One of the winning points of this hostel is LOCATION! It is literally a two minute walk from the beach and the main street. Wifi was rather unpredictable but still managed to work in some locations, notably in the staircase!

This hostel is a great social hostel. Everyone ate, drank, partied together in the evenings and many of us also ended up doing stuff during the days together too.Particularly good for solo/small group travellers, wouldn't recommend for families.Everyone who worked there was friendly and informative.The place wasn't the cleanest place I've ever been but wasn't dirty, and certainly the friendliest hostel I've ever stayed in. Loved it!

My partner and I stayed here in March (sorry for the late review) and we absolutely loved it.It was great value for money, the staff were nice and helpful and the rooms were comfortable and clean. We stayed in room 4 which was on the ground floor at the back of the building next to the washing machines. Some of the great features were that we had a full kitchen and large fridge, air conditioning and a nice clean bathroom. The bed was so comfy.The location was incredible, and was only a 2 minute walk to the main beach of Waikiki.Overall we had a really great experience. I work in the travel industry in Australia and I highly recommend this place for people who don't need all the facilities you get at a large resort. We had no problems at all.

This place is great. They have free beers at the kitchen which is kinda the place to hang out and meet people although its not to big which i see as kind of a good thing because it forces you to talk to people and stuff. i really liked it. I met people from all over the world and made plans to hike and go around the island with people i met there. if it wasn't for this hostel and the people i met there i probably wouldn't have found out about stairway to heaven which was the best hike i have ever done in my life. it can be a little dirty and the only bad thing could be the bathroom. the water pressure was really bad but it all part of the travelling experience. so if you're down for an adventure and you wanna meet people and go a little crazy in Hawaii then i recommend this hostel. the staff is really helpful and friendly too.

Firstly, I've probably rated this a bit higher than deserved, since it's meant more for surfer dudes and backpackers, yet I brought my family there (wife and two young children). We decided to stay here because we wanted to spend a few days at North Shore (which is absolutely beautiful by the way), but other nearby accommodation (such as Turtle Bay Resort) was very expensive. As soon as we came into the room, we were greeted by a medium sized cockroach running out of the sink, and about 30 flies (the sort that land on dog poo). I went to the local store and purchased some roach traps and a fly swatter, and proceeded to execute the flies and lay the traps. This solved most of our problems, and we ended up with about 4 roaches in the traps after 2 days, including one giant one!One of the cupboards was hanging off, and we didn't even dare to use any of the plates, etc. What did make me laugh was a tips jar on top of the cupboard; and people had actually being putting tips in!A big positive about this place, is that the balcony of the room overlooked a gorgeous mixed rock/sand beach, with the room being about 3 metres from the sea. Unfortunately our balcony door would not open, so we couldn't enjoy it!In fairness, if you aren't bothered too much about creepy crawlies, and need a cheap place to crash while you enjoy the beauty of the North Shore, then it's not bad for the cost.

Let me start out by pointing out that this is a hostel, not a hotel. So don't expect luxury at its finest. The rooms are small and can be a little cleaner. However, it's not as bad as everyone thinks. Besides, you're in Hawaii to explore and have fun! Not coop yourselves up in a room. Location is perfect. Three minute walk to the beach, stores, food places. Add another five minutes and you'll be at the zoo. While I was there, they had Free Beer Nights on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and Free Pizza Fridays. As for the employees, love them!! They're very friendly and I was acquainted with everyone in no time. Such an amazing atmosphere. Super chill! I prioritize experience over luxury, so if you're anything like me, then I definitely recommend hostels over hotels.

Such an expensive hostel and the only positive is that it's a short walk to the beach. We had a private room (which was a 4-bed dorm with the bottom bunk as a double bed). Room was dirty with band aids left in the shower, the vanity in the bathroom was broken, there was a broken tv stuffed in a closet and random contractors were inside our locked, private room when we weren't there without us getting a warning or notice. General dirtiness to room, the staff was different everyday and didn't know anything. Someone was sleeping nude in the office and they didn't open office or breakfast room when advertised.

started off bad from the time I arrived at 2:30. I didnt get checked in til 4:30. The lady working was absolutely useless and very rude, and several other backpackers had issues with her. We were interrupting her facebooking or games! Then 3pm comes and shift change, this guy Siam had me wait an hour and a half to get checked in after 11 hour flight. He only wanted to help the female guests. Pizza and beer night was a joke, not enough for everybody. Overpriced. There is better value nearby

The hostel is very nicely built and maintained. The rooms have a small kitchen area and a refrigerator. The hostel front gate is locked at night for security, but the residents have a key. I love the free pizza nights, which is a great way to meet other residents.

The most horrible place to be ! Ex pensive price for hugglie place. You should never go here. The staf is inisefull and room not clean. This fuking place gone stay in my mind forever as the place where anyone must never go for any reasons. If you go there you make à terrible mistake.

The best thing about this place is the location. It is very close to the beach and all amenities and anything you need. Easy to get to via shuttle or public transportation. Never used a taxi in the area, but heard they are very expensive. The hostel itself, has been updated and has attempted to keep the place clean, but I think our experience was reduced by our roommates. We bunked with one of the workers, and the room was a disaster. He had clothes all over the floor and, on all the bunks. There were moldy dirty dishes in the sink, and cockroaches through out the room. Bugs don't bother me much, but there was a definite cockroach problem in our room, but I would say it might be isolated to the room we stayed in as it was not kept clean. Other guest even commented on how bad our room smelled compared to theirs, so I don't think it's the hostel. The other guests were great, good vibe in the hostel, lots of new friends, good conversation. Would still recommend the place based on location and price. The day shift staff were awesome and extremely helpful!

The hostel is clean, and if you want to stay in Waikiki it's in a great location, close to the beach and my preffered (south) end... i.e. not overrun by chain stores (but close enough ~5mins walk). The staff are a bit clueless about the island and what it has to offer which is a shame, but overall friendly enough.

I stayed here for four nighs in August when I was on holiday in Waikiki. This place is nice, very tropical yard, nice rooms with lovely comfy bed.I was surprise with some nasty review I read about this hostel. Free breakfast and pizza on some days

This was a good value for the money we spent. It was close to the beach and restaurants. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The rooms were pretty basic, but to be expected for the location and price.

I just wanted to say what a fantastic time I had recently staying at the Waikiki Backpackers Hostel. The staff was fantastic, the accomodations were well-located and clean, and the meals were just enough to start the day. I would wholeheartedly recommend this to any hosteler looking for a great value and a supurb hosteling experience.

Rooms were clean and spacious enough. Fellow occupants during our stay were respectful. Breakfast is weak (toast, butter, jam, and 1 yogurt), but you can't have it all, I suppose.Great location on the eastern end of Waikiki beach-- essentially right on the main beach and tourist drag. That said, we appreciated being able to easily access life outside of Waikiki, as the Diamond's Head attraction was only a ~3 mi away. I'd stay here again. The price is right for downtown Honolulu. You stay in HI for the outdoors and the beach, so I'd recommend skimping on loding costs and just crashing here.

review_body: Well located, two blocks from Waikiki beach. I booked a private double room (room 4). It had a wood carpet, king size bed, big LCD TV, fridge, microwave, air conditioner, fan, private bathroom and closed. Internet wifi signal was not working in my bedroom (low signal), but at the kitchen and office, it worked fine (good speed).The cold water pressure in the shower was low, but enough, not a problem. In front of my room there were two chairs, a table and a deck chair.Common kitchen was well equipped, with toaster, fridge, microwave and oven. Breakfast included 4 pieces of bread, coffee, butter, jam and one yogurt (one of the days I was there, there were 2 eggs for each person).Everything was clean. Bedroom windows have bug protection.They cold just put an advertisement in front of the building, in order to make it more visible.Staff was always ready to help, and they gave me several hints for my trip.Some days I've heard some noise during the night, about people arriving, but nothing that would bother my sleep. Nice place, nice price, nice staff... I recommend!

I Love this hostel. Staff was really nice and helpfull. The rooms were really clean and the location was soooo good :) If I ever go to Honolulu I´ll stay at this hostel again. I will recommend this place. Really cheap. And the people there! So nice people all over the world! I had a great time.

Helsinki, Southern Finland, Finland

review_body: This hostel is very nice and centrally located. I think it's a much more low key hostel where one can get a good sleep instead of sleepless night due to noise. I am very pleased with my stay and I will stay there again.

The top real hostel experience! The location is perfect to everything (including the beach), great rooms, Jessie the head guy who works during the day went out of his way to help me with advice and book other places for my further trips (above and beyond). I had the greatest time on my travels here.

This was my first "real" hostel experience. I've stayed in a few hostels (and other similar accommodations) before while traveling through Japan, but I was with my family and we reserved the entire room, so with the exception of sharing bathrooms with strangers, the "sleeping quarters" were shared between just my family.I came to this hostel with very low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. From speaking to the other people in the room who seemed to have extensive experiences with hostels, the general consensus was that this place is "just average". The 6 person room (3 bunks) was much smaller than I excepted, especially given the picture on the website. The mini "kitchen" area in the room was quite nice, but created a bug problem because 1) people don't clean up after themselves and 2) there doesn't seem to be any real cleaning staff on the premise. In fact, one of my "room mates" volunteered (?) to clean the rooms in return for free accommodations. Parking is tight (4-5 spots only) so make sure you can park your car there if you have a rental. $10/night for parking wasn't too bad and I like they had towel service for only $0.50/towel. I wish the facilities, rooms, and premise were consistently much cleaner, but I guess you can't expect much from a hostel that's pretty cheap (average price?). I did like the hotel staff - they were friendly and accommodating and the location was super prime. Will I return here again? Perhaps, but if I find a better hostel the next time I visit Waikiki, then probably not...

review_body: Like a converted hotel. The dorm rooms are like a standard hotel room with an ensuite bathroom with three bunk beds, a full size refrigerator, sink and microwave. AC works just fine.Staff good and a location hard to beat. Safeway is probably 15 minute walk along with better food choices than the main Waikiki strip. Fast, free WiFi.

This place is great! It's no 5star hotel but having stayed at all the other hostels in the area as well I can definately say it is the best! Private rooms are large, bed is big (although a little uncomfortable), has a flat screen in the room, it is also the only hostel in Waikiki with an indoor kitchen/socializing area. Location is right by the beach and probably a 5min walk to most of the downtown action. Id stay here again :)

Maybe the best hostel I've been to. Good facilities , great great staff - especially Jessy and Jeana - amazing ppl :-). Had great time there. The atmosphere was great, hanging out together in the common area and than in Waikiki.Facilities-wise - shower& toilet in every room, fridge& microwave in each & every room! No need to fight over space :-)Located great just 1 min from the beach, close to the bars and restaurantsEnjoyed very very much my stay here (10 nights)

I absolutely loved this hostel. The atmosphere and staff are fantastic and I left with lifelong friends. The owner does a lot for his guests such as free pizza & beer nights, free dinners when he feels so inclines, free shuttle service to bars and tours in the company van to accommodate requests and which beat the price of any other tour operaters out there!The breakfast is good & the rooms are great (there is a massive fridge/freezer in every room and a little kitchenette with a microwave). No lockers unfortunately so bring a lock for your bag. Saw some people locking bags to their beds which was a clever idea. The gate is locked at 11pm though so no one from outside the hostel can get in.There is a nice outside socialsing area open until 11pm and a fab hammock out the back. I spent a lot of time recovering on that...The staff are all awesome! Willing to help and very nice, fun people. This hostel has only been open 8 months so the front desk process is slow and organisation somewhat lacking. It is a shame cos this hostel is so great in every other way but for a new business they really aren't doing badly.If I went back to Waikiki I wouldn't even look to stay anywhere else!If they added lockers and had a little more organisation at the front desk I would be giving 5 stars. But I encourage anyone to look past this and give this place a shot. It is awesome!
